Hmm, to me?
Remember what that harpy warrior said?
Her queen wants the Holy Sword to solve the matter.
You're quite a keen one, impressive.
As you know, I did not know that the Holy Sword even existed before I met our warrior.
I thought the warrior would be someone with energy more pure and brilliant than that of ordinary humans.
It is true that the harpies can sense many things with wind,
but even for them, it's not easy to recognize the Holy Sword without prior knowledge or exposure to it.
I see. So what was the elves' original plan to destroy the Core of Darkness?
Is there a way to destroy it without using the power of the Holy Sword?
I do not know much about that. I trust Lorraine, and act as she speaks.
I have faith that, through Lorraine, the Core of Darkness will soon be destroyed, and those who are suffering will be freed as well.
Is something wrong? Or is it that you don't trust me?
No, I was just pulling my thoughts together.
I see. Is there anything more you wish to talk about?
That was more than enough. Thank you for the conversation.
Well then, I'll get going to see the warrior. I shouldn't be away from him for too long.
Okay.
(Hm... It doesn't sound like the princess is lying...)
(That means the harpy queen must be the one who's lying...)
(The fact that she knew that her people are going mad, and she had prior knowledge about the Holy Sword...)
(Moreover, the Holy Sword is not exactly needed to destroy the Core of Darkness...)
(These two facts are more than enough to say that she wants to lure Kasel and the Holy Sword...)
(But that harpy warrior doesn't seem to know anything about her queen's intention...)
(Argh... This is so obvious, but on the other hand, nothing is perfectly certain yet.)
(I guess I have no choice but to watch how the situation unfolds for now...)
How could such a thing happen...
They look like soulless zombies... Is that what the Core of Darkness is capable of?
Their bodies and minds have succumbed to the power of darkness
Naila...
We have no choice... but to defeat them to move on.
We are almost at the Lake of Eternity.
My sister should be waiting for you at the entrance.
(Waiting for us...?)
Wait, I have a bad feeling about this. This might be a trap.
Princess Selene, what are you saying? Do you doubt me?
We elves did not know anything about the Holy Sword before we met our warrior.
But you, the protectors of the Lake of Eternity, already knew about the Holy Sword and have been waiting for us?
We've also seen corrupted harpies on our way here.
Sorry to say this, but we have every right to be suspicious.
Does that mean you are doubting my sister and all my kin?
Not all harpies are corrupted. Please refrain from suspecting us.
What should we do?
Princess Selene has a point, but Naila doesn't look like someone who would lie...
(Princess Selene absolutely has a point...)
(But she is being too direct with her suspicion. This is troublesome...)
Um... Roi?
This is tough. Princess has a point, and I agree with her but...
But it is true that the harpies were acting strangely.
And don't forget that chicken-bird one attacked us and tried to forcefully take away the Holy Sword.
Hmm... How about you, Kasel. Any thoughts?
I think we should trust Naila.
My warrior!
Kasel, are you really sure about that?
If she wanted to trick us, then she wouldn't have fought us directly in the first place.
She could've just made us lower our guards, then take away the Holy Sword.
But...!
Moreover, Naila put down her own kin to guide us here.
Though they were corrupted by darkness, those harpies were her friends and sisters.
But us? We are just outsiders to her.
I don't think it was an easy decision to attack her own kin to help outsiders.
I think that Naila's heart is in the right place. She really wants to save her kin.
Human...
Impressive, Kasel. Didn't expect to hear such thoughtful words from you.
I know right? Where did our indecisive Kasel at the World Tree go?
Hahaha... I voiced my opinion, that's all.
No, Kasel. That was brilliant.
Thank you, Frey.
Anyways, I think we should make haste. We have no time for more talks.
Please lead us the way, Naila.

Calm down, we are not trying to hurt you.
You attacked us first, and we only fought back.
Ach! Orcs trick us!
Lua Order Human nice!
Thank you.
If possible, could you tell me why you had to attack us?
We Goblins exiled from Kings Plains, ach.
Do Orcs chores, get food.
Now Orcs say kill Humans, or they kill Goblins!
Why did the orcs tell you to kill humans?
Ach! Dunno!
Why were you exiled from the Kings Plains?
Erk...Bodakka...Bodakka exile us!
Ach! He say, no need weak Goblin!
Weak goblins? With this kind of weaponry, Bodakka looks insignificant in comparison.
Weapons, 'He' give us!
He' free Goblins from Orc!
Who is this 'He'?
Sorry, ach... Can't say. We secret...eh...
Residence?
Resistance?
Yes, Resistance! Anyway, secret, ach. Can't say.
Well, that's it I guess. We'll try to figure out the rest some other way.
Thank you for telling us what you know.
Ach...Other Goblins, still attack you.
Sorry advance! Go easy them, ach...
Front go!
Yay, Golem works!!!
Come!!
Control Golem! 'He' genius!!
Cleo. Cleo?
Well well, it seems she's shocked to see goblins controlling golems.
They succeeded where she failed, after all.
Roiiiiiiii!!!!!
Ach! Human!
Ach! Spy us! Orcs make Humans spy on us!
We aren't spies...
Not like they'll understand before we beat them up.
Bring it on, you dumb goblins!
I'll make you pay for humiliating me!!
Fufufu, piece of cake!!
Cleo, you're breathing rather loudly.
Hmph, I'm not tired at all!
She's clearly mad. After all, those 'dumb goblins' did beat her at controlling a golem...
That's not true,stupid Roi!!!
Kyak!! Stop! Human me friend!
Lakrak?
Wait, you are..?!
Crow witch! I've been waiting for you!
I want to ask you about your old friend you mentioned before...
Fufu, you are a stubborn lady.
If you help me, I will tell you what you wish to hear.
What!? Are you telling me to help demons!?
Fufu, don't panic. I'm not asking for much.
Lakrak. You seem to be on the same side with her.
Why are you allied with Demons?
Ack? This woman demon?
So...are you really going to give up now? White Goblin.
Demon or not, no care!! Ach!
She help make strong weapon!!
Ah...Lua, my Goddess..
Please save that poor goblin's soul from the clutches of darkness...
You silly priest. Lua won't save anyone.
Pray on all you want, but she will never respond.
That damned goddess...
What? How dare...
No, the holy sword is proof enough.
It is a present from the goddess, bearing her wish to stop the demons from destroying this world, like you did long ago!!
Fufufu...
Hahahahahaha!
A present? That thing?
Believe what you want to believe. Deeply...yes, wholeheartedly.
Only then will you despair, cursing Lua and the holy sword.
I really want to witness your cute face twist in horror and despair, streaked with tears...
What!? What are you talking about?
Fufufu...
Let's meet again. Child of Arlette.
Wait! Witch!
Arlette... She called me a child of Arlette.
Roi, that's it..! My mother's name is Arlette..!
Hah...Lakrak.
After you appeared with that witch, Maria, everything is a mess.
Did you really decide to team up with the Demons?
Team up Demons? Ach, no!
I no know woman Demon!
I don't think she is a demon, really...
I know she's a human. But is she on the side of Demons?
That's none of our business.
What's important is that the witch is dangerous to us.
And Lakrak, we need to know why you were with her.
Ach! Me journey, make powerful weapon!
I meet her here!
She say, me help make powerful weapon, ach!
Weapon impossible just tech! Magic Weapon!
She help, golem controller make!
I knew it!
I knew a goblin couldn't create a golem controller on its own.
You look relieved, Cleo.
Of course! Though I was surprised a bit at first.
The woman said my mother's name aloud and disappeared.
For what reason has she...?
Ach, powerful weapon free no!
Goblin save from orc, payment!
*Sigh*... then the 'He' that goblins were bragging about was..
Never expected it to be Lakrak.
So bother, ach! Lead dumb goblin crowd, bah!
But why is Maria helping the goblins?
Kyak! Dunno! No important!
I focus strong weapon!
She said we'd meet again...You can ask her then.
That's not the only question I should ask of her.
She must know something about my mom too...
Also...what she mentioned about me cursing the Lua...
Is Lakrak coming with us?
Test Custom Hand-Cannon Lakrak MK-3, Orc subject! Yes!
Can't you test things by yourself?
Ugh.... That's...
Allied situation test!
Ach, testing efficiency when fight together!!
Yeah, yeah, whatever you say.
That is a misunderstanding, Throne. Listen to me...
I have listened to you words after words.
They are but nonsense and drivel.
That's not true.
The orcs seem to have some issues of their own...
Oh... You must be...
the successor of the holy sword!
Wait, how did you...
Look, Throne. Here is the successor of the holy sword that I mentioned earlier.
A holy sword? Psh... what's the use of it now anyway?
Throne. The emergence of holy sword means that the world is in danger.
The orcs are already in a crisis.
Because of those humans!
We have no idea what you are talking about...
Move, Kaulah! I will cut you down if you don't.
Ah... forgive me, Throne.
Kaulah!!!
You...you traitor...
How can you stand on their side... those treacherous...
I'm terribly sorry, Throne.
You... our brothers will not let this go.
They will chase after you.... to the end of the world... Kaulah....
You will pay for...your betrayal...
Throne.. Throne!!
I'm sorry. I could not choose otherwise, forgive me...
May the blessing of Lua be with you.
I'm sorry you had to go through all this because of me...and upon all that be branded as a traitor...
How did you know that Kasel was the successor of the holy sword?
Is his name Kasel?
I had a prophetic dream of him holding the holy sword.
A prophetic dream?!
I've heard of those before.
Some of the superior shaman orcs can see the future ahead through their prophetic dreams.
You've said the orcs were in danger because of the humans. What in the world is happening?
Recently, some of my brethren have been going missing...
And there was a rumor...
that humans were enslaving us.
Unbelievable!
Humans, taking orcs as slaves!? That's a total nonsense!
We've never ever heard of it nor seen it!!
I know. I believe you.
The other orcs, however, believe this is true.
The High Chieftain Sieg is especially angry, and has a hatred of humans.
Sieg? Is he the current High chieftain?
What about Garuk?
Garuk trusted the humans.
So Sieg challenged him to a duel, and killed him to become the next High Chieftain.
Isn't that... treason?
Orcs sometimes choose their leader like that.
That's quite barbarious.
It was, in fact, a dead tradition.
However, as rage against the humans rose,
Sieg had the support of many of my kind who believed we should strike back at the humans.
He then used the duel as a means of showing he would revive old traditions.
What is the possibility that humans are indeed enslaving orcs?
Like, perhaps that empire.
The Vespian Empire?
No, it wouldn't make any sense.
They have no reason to come this far for mere slaves. Their land is too far away.
Hmm... I see.
We should go meet the High Chieftain to sort out this misunderstanding.
We should first meet my apprentice, Dain. He will be able to help us.
Do you know about the divided power of the holy sword?
Yes. Our legendary High Chieftain, Aeatola,
the Orc hero that had helped Kyle at the time, put the power into a talisman.
The talisman has then passed on to each generation of High Chieftains.
Then Sieg must have it now.
Correct.
*Sigh*...what a pain.
We will be able to meet Dain, north from here.
I hope no harm befell him because of me...
Goddess Lua, please protect Dain, the apprentice of Kaulah.
We should hurry before anything bad happens.
Master! Are you all right?
Oh, Dain. Thank the heavens. I was worried about you.
And I am still worried about you to this day
Why are you with humans in these dangerous times?
I'm sorry...Kaulah was branded a traitor because of us.
I have something private to discuss with my master, could you guests wait here for a while?
Of course.
What, what is it?
A trap?!
What is going on, Dain?!
I have to get rid of the humans, master. I'm sorry.
This is the only way to keep you alive.
You blinded fool... The darkness is attempting to swallow this very world.
The safety of the orcs is not the only thing at stake!!
We're gonna fall!!
Kasel: Frey!!
Frey: Kyaaaaaa!
Kasel: No, Lua, Please...
Kasel: Protect Frey.. Please!!! If anyone has to die, please let it be me...and not Frey!!
Cleo: Frey!!!
Roi: Guh...
Cleo: Won't...give up!!!
Roi: Give me your hand, Kasel!!!
Roi: I got you!! Up, now, Cleo!
Cleo: Okay, Let me show you what speed is!!!
Cleo: My staff is the staff to pierce the heavens!!!
Roi: Ugh... we saved them, you can slow down now...
What are you planning.
This is the order of the High Chieftain Sieg. He said he would kill you if we didn't get rid of the humans.
Absurd...Are you trying to doom the world with darkness because of me!?
That is why... we have come to save the world from the darkness!
Oh... You are alive.
Grk...You shouldn't be alive!!!
Die!!!
Stop!! Dain, Stop!!
I'm sorry, Kaulah. We have to defend ourselves...
Kugh.... They are strong...
Let's stop now, Dain. These people can beat some sense into Sieg.
That...sounds possible...
What did you do that for?!!
Humph, Orcs are so naive.
Well, that is the cause of this entire mess, anyhow.
Maria!! Why...
Not only the orcs, but you too are all so nave.
Did you really think you'd be able to persuade him?
We should at least try!
And then you will die trying.
I can't have you dying, just yet.
And why is that?
Hmm, don't you remember?
I said I want to see you in a certain situation.
Was that about us cursing Lua?
Yeah, I wanted to ask you what you meant about that.
Fufufu, you'll have to figure that out by yourself.
There are so many more stories to tell you.
Okay, then tell me about my mother Arlette..
Fufufu, Arlette.. I never said Arlette was your mother...
What?
Come to think of it, all four of us don't know our parents.
Do you know any other of our parents, aside from Cleo's?
Fufu, Don't rush. Take it easy.
Today I came to tell you another story.
A story about who triggered the Orcish hatred for humans.
I wonder if you know him... a certain Malduk.
Malduk..!!
The Strategist of Angmund...? That Malduk?
Yes. He has been turning Orcs into undead since quite some time ago.
He then lied to the Orcs, including Sieg, that the humans were to blame for the missing Orcs.
That nasty..
Why are you telling us all this?
Aren't you allied with the Demons?
I didn't like that bony bastard to begin with.
Then...the reason you were trying to get the Goblins to confront the Orcs alongside Lakrak...
Yes, Malduk had taken advantage of the Orcs.
So, I took advantage of the Goblins, considering they hold a grudge towards the Orcs.
Malduk aside, you are really evil.
Both sides will sustain terrible losses once they clash,
and the hatred between both sides will only grow larger!
So? As part of the Demon Army, I consider it a win if you idiots have a falling out.
What?!
Damn... Trying to break apart the alliance between the races of this world...
We have to report this to Orvelia.
Fufufu, the Orvelians won't do anything about it.
The royal family and the aristocrats will hole up in their little palace and think about how to survive, even if they have to throw away everything else.
In the meanwhile... they'd try to kill you so the news doesn't spread.
How dare you insult the Orvelian Royalty!!
Fufu... Nave. Nave as usual.
Anyway, you wouldn't want to tell Orvelia about this.
Not that they would even be a match for the Demon Army, anyway.
As things are right now, Orvel is an easy target - overthrowing it is nothing.
So, mark my words. If you do as I say, an all-out war will not occur.
And why should we trust you?
You don't need to.
The choice is yours.
Goodbye, then. We'll meet again.
You old hag..!
Don't just leave like that!
Goddess Lua, please forgive Dain...
who made a dire choice for his master.
I thank you for praying for my apprentice...
I assume it'd be easier to beat down Sieg rather than pursuade him.
I'm pretty sure the Orcs will try to stop us.
We'd have no choice but to beat them up in order to progress, Kaulah.
I will come with you. I will try to...persuade them.
If it doesn't work...
I will help you. I have already stained my hands with the blood of my kind.
I'm sorry, Kaulah... for involving you in this situation.
This is not your fault, Kasel.
There will be bigger losses if we do not stop this war. We must try our best.
Kasel, I agree with Maria..
You should wait before reporting this crisis to Orvelia.
I believe so too.
The Laughing Masks... We don't know who they work for...
and whose will it is to kill me...
Kasel...
I'll find out one day, surely.
But that's not what's important now. This comes first.
Kaulah!
It's the traitor, Kaulah!
Comrades, We'd been fooled by the Demons.
Malduk, the Demon's strategist was the one who'd been kidnapping us Orcs and turning them into the undead..
Who would listen to a traitor's words!!
Pay for your sins with death, Kaulah!
I knew this would happen.
We can't give up on persuading them, Roi.
Yeah, Roi, We should try our best!
*Sigh*... Cleo, How about reflecting on yourself a bit?
Later! We need to beat these guys up first!
Go easy on them, please.
Hmm, there's a battle going on already.
Wow... Lakrak is leading all those goblins and golems...
I don't like this...! Humph!
My experiment near end! Ach!
Leave now, make stronger weapon!!
Lakrak. What about the Goblins here following you..
Who care!!
Give golem control and machine, they do they want!! Kyak!
I follow you, I find strong test subject!
Wait bit! I follow after test, kyak!!
I'm up for that, my friend.
I'm not. I don't want to be on the same team with Goblins..
Cleo, no discrimination against the other races without reason.
So..sorry.... Just don't tell me to sleep alone from now on.
I can't fall asleep without Frey anymore..
Is this about that pillow thing...
Frey, you've got a small problem now, hahaha.
Sieg!!
Is the one next to him Malduk?
I guess so. Look, skulls!
Sieg!! We were all deceived by him!
He blamed humans for all that he had done to the Orcs! He's the one who captured Orcs, turning them into undead!
What?!
Honorable High Chieftain,
a great warrior like you wouldn't have killed your most honored predecessor, Garuk, out of a small misunderstanding.
Everything you did was for your race. For the sake of your tribe.
These imbeciles are insulting your decision, your honor.
They must pay with their lives.
...Yes.
Indeed! I am the leader of Orcs. I will not forgive the humans that enslaved my kind!
That includes you, Kaulah! Pay for your betrayal!!
What a blockhead...
He just can't admit the truth.
The truth that he killed Garuk out of a misunderstanding...
Pay for your sins with death!!!
That's a High Chieftain. What strength...
Kasel, Can't you use the power of the holy sword?
I'm sorry... I... I'm not capable of controlling it yet..
The power just comes out on its own...
Jeez, don't apologize for everything!
We'll finish this somehow!
Kugh... Malduk.... Malduk!!!
I'm done for....
Save my tribe... from those treacherous human beings.
Kukukukuku....
Kakaka..kahahahahahaha!!!
Idiotic Orc.
Wha..what are you laughing at?!
The missing Orcs will soon rise again as undead
and become loyal members of the Demon Army.
What...have I done..
You killed Garuk out of a small misunderstanding, that's all.
Kukukuku.....
Sieg!!!!
Did...did you really have to...
Did you have to laugh at a dying person, insulting their last moments!!
Kukuku...
I see...Wielder of the holy sword...
How do you feel, hmm? Don't you feel any anger inside of you?
You... I will never forgive you!
Yes, that's right.
Beautiful.
Hahahaha!
Rage! Fury! Hate! More, more, stain the holy sword in even more darkness!!!
I hope the next time we cross paths, you will show me even greater hatred.
Don't run, coward!!
Damn, he lost us.
Aaaaaaaah!
Guh... Kasel!
Kasel, no!!
Stay strong, please...
Kugh...
Grrk...kugh...
Frey.. Th..Thank you..
Kasel!
Kasel... Kasel!!!
Ugh...
Malduk!!!
Calm down, Kasel. Malduk is gone.
Is it because he left...
I think I went crazy for a bit there...
Yeah, but...
thanks to Frey, nothing went wrong.
Frey called for Kasel, and then you came back to normal without any issues.
Thank you, Frey.
Everything's okay, Kasel.
What about Sieg... what about the Orcs of Ogria.
I will lead the tribe until the next chieftain is chosen. I'm the highest ranking shaman here so far.
Don't worry about us.
Now that we've gained the talisman of Aeatola, we should transfer its power back into the holy sword.
Not now...
Please, hold onto the talisman for now.
Shouldn't you return its power?
I'm not capable of controlling Aea yet. It's too early...
If I fail to control the sword's power after it gets stronger...
I can't be sure who or where I'll be aiming the sword at....
Kasel...
Anyway, we should still figure out where the rest of the power is.
It's still part of my mission.
Of course.
I assume that the Northern Barbarians would have another portion of the power.
Ugh..You mean the barbarian empire beyond the high cliff? I heard that even birds can't fly over that cliff.
Correct. We have no choice but to pass through Galluah and Aegina.
Which way is Galluah?
To the south.
It will be a long trip.
The Barbarian Empire... It will be our first time meeting humans of a different country, Kasel.
Yeah, I hope we don't cause them any trouble.
When I was inside the dark, I heard Frey's voice...it was weaker than before...
Someday... I might not be able to hear her voice at all
and sink into the abyss of darkness...
Before that, I have to give back the holy sword to my king.
Now, though...I wonder if thats the right thing to do.
Did Malduk head to Galluah?
Yes.
I guess it would be too much to expect much from those greenhorns.
If you expected them to kill Malduk...
Yes, I agree.
I see.
I think...I've become a little too talkative.
There was plenty of time to forget everything...
I thought I had forgotten everything.
But as soon as I saw her child...all my pent up anger and frustration bubbled up.
Maria..
Fufufu...
Well, no matter.
They are still puppets of Lua.
Nothing I do will even register in comparison to what Lua has in store for them...
Did Epis head towards Galluah?
Yes. After she heard about you, she seemed to be in a hurry.
Fufufu... Now all we have to do is to enjoy the puppet show in Galluah.
Ugh... This place is freaky.
Of course. This land is called the Land of Death.
Land of Death?
It's a land devastated by past wars.
There used to be a number of human dukedoms in Galluah.
They often warred with the Orc tribes,
but they were all destroyed after the sudden appearance of the Demon Army.
Now, not a single sapient being exists in this land.
Whoa, is that a floating sword with a mouth on it?
A living sword...!
Apparently Galluah has been completely overrun by Demons.
Are those Demon weapons?
Not exactly. Those aren't really weapons, they're actually Demons.
The Demon's World, which is called the World of Darkness, has no form.
The entities from that world also have no form.
So when the Demons crossed over the Gate into this world, Angmund gave them material form.
Also, as he corrupted the land, he injected the souls of Demons into the entities of this world.
These beings are all categorized as Demons.
Living equipment like that living sword are also part of the latter type of Demon.
It's my first time seeing these Demons, but low class Demons such as these aren't a problem for an archmage such as myself!
Hmm.. If the world of darkness has no form...
would Lua and the World of Light exist under the same rules?
Yes. Lua too is a spiritual existence,
but she materializes herself when she shows herself to us in this world.
The World of Light is also called the realm of the gods,
and it is said that they can create any kind of element or material.
Magicians thus categorize our world as 'The Material World',
to distinguish it from the other formless worlds.
I know you guys are brawny rather than brainy, but this much is basic knowledge. Remember it!
Golems again, huh.
They must be Galluan Golems, created by the human dukedoms for their wars against the Orcs.
Now, however...it seems the Demons control them.
We should have borrowed a golem controller from Lakrak.
*Sigh*...blade users...
Once a golem is under the control of a person, nobody can hijack that particular golem.
Golems that have lost their masters and deactivated are a different case, though.
Ugh. Are those the rumoured beasts afflicted by the Dark Disease?
They look much worse than what the rumours say...
Poor animals...The skin is all ripped apart, and the bones are poking out of its body...
Is the Dark Disease also caused by the Demons?
It's hard to say it is...
but there is a connection between the two.
I think I mentioned this in Ellidora,
but remember when I said there are cases of Demons taking over animals?
Yes. I remember.
The Dark Disease is a side effect of that case.
The afflicted animal struggles in pain, hurting itself in the process.
Considering the bones...I'd say this one has been afflicted for a few months.
That's around the time that the Demons began to re-emerge.
We need to put these poor children to rest.
If the disease is triggered by the corruption of Darkness,
Would the dryads and harpies of Ellidora be okay?
We don't have to worry about them for now.
The Nucleus of Darkness is structured in a different way,
in comparison to how Demons control animals.
How do you know that?
I took a few samples of the destroyed Nucleus for study.
Did you really think I'd overlook such a dangerous item without studying it?
Ha, you really did well, Cleo.
Ew...It's weird to hear you compliment me.
*Sigh*...give me back my gratitude.
Hm? What is it, Kasel?
Kasel... Don't be anxious. You are not a helpless child anymore.
I'm fine. I was just... a little surprised.
You don't seem like your usual self, Kasel.
It's a vague memory... but when I was younger, my village was attacked by Demons.
seeing that Demon just...reminded me of that day. It's ok. I'm fine.
Let's get rid of those enemies and continue on our way.
Huff...huff...
You okay, Kasel?
Yeah I'm fine. They weren't that strong, really.
Fufu, see? You are no more the kid who used to cry every time when faced with a skeleton model.
Come on, Frey. Don't remind me of that.
What is it, what is it??
When we were still children living at the orphanage,
the principal brought a skeleton model to class to teach us about the human body.
Kasel got extremely frightened and started to cry.
Everyone, including me started teasing him about being a crybaby...
Frey made fun of someone!?
Well, it was when she was young.
On the other hand, I'd say your mental age is the same as back then...
*Sigh*...and you just complemented me moments ago...
It wasn't worth it, so yeah.
When I heard the story of Kasel's family and the Demon invasion afterwards, I felt really bad about it...
Perhaps Lua gave me the task of helping Kasel,
because I made fun of him back then.
Tiring, isn't it?
Pshhh..it was a joke, Kasel. A joke!
I don't know how you feel about it, but I am happy that Lua chose me.
Oh...Frey is making jokes. This is new.
Silly, wasn't I? Haha... old memories...
Silly, huh. If you think that's silly, just take a look at Cleo.
Roi!!!!
It suits Cleo to be bright and cheerful. But I should act like a priest.
Yes...because I am a priest,
I can follow the path Lua wants me to.
But Kasel...
I suppose Lua wouldn't remove Kasel's burden even if I prayed for it...
Eww, what is that giant head?!
It looks like the skull of giants that lived here in ancient times.
Those actually existed...?
Before the Demons invaded 100 years ago,
people believed that the World of Light and Darkness were just fables and myths.
The fact that legend of giants was true doesn't even surprise me now.
*Sigh*...Malduk...
He really went and made all kinds of weird undead!
Malduk did this?
Yeah, stupid Roi wouldn't know, would he?
Malduk was Angmund's strategist, but he is also called the Father of Undead.
He's the one who infused Demon souls into dead bodies.
Some people say Malduk himself underwent the same process when he came to this world through the gate.
Those skeletons are much more difficult to deal with compared to living weapons,
probably because there were once alive, too.
Hasn't it become darker around here?
Cleo...Can you feel this?
Yes...This is bad...I sense some really dangerous mana...
Dangerous mana... Referring to yourself, hmm?
Wh..Who are you!!
I am you. The poor little girl with dangerous magic power, abandoned by her parents.
What?! Don't make me laugh.
Hahaha, yes, you too. I can't help laughing at the sight of you.
You act big to hide your loneliness in the day, and cry over your mother in the night..
You say you left to find your mother, but I know the truth.
You just didn't want to stay in the Tower of the Sage.
All the people you hurt due to your powerful magic.
You just wanted to run away from them and their cold gazes, right?
Now tell me. Are you really seeking for your mother?
The fact is, you're scared, aren't you? Scared of meeting your mother, the one who gave you your mana.
The one who threw you away, even before you could remember her face/
What...who do you think you are?!
I'm Cleo. The poor, lonely girl who can't stop crying in her sleep without Frey.
I'd rather fall asleep next to Frey forever than go through the painful search for my mom...
How long will that be possible...
You idiot! How can you call yourself an archmage, being tricked by something like this!?
Hahaha, like you ever acknowledged Cleo as an archmage.
Who are you!? What is your goal?!
You still haven't figured it out?
I am you. The Dark Reaper, Roi.
C'mon. It's dark outside, so it's time to go to work. Like any other time, the reward will be big.
Considering we're taking the lives of upstanding people, there's no way the reward can be small, right?
Let's see... How much for the heads of those three idiots?
Shut up!!!
Shut up? What do you mean, shut up.
You had this conversation a few years ago with your old Laughing Mask friends, right?
Stop...not in front of Cleo and the others...
Haha, why? Why not?
What are you afraid of?
Are you afraid that those nave children following after the light will be disgusted of you for trading lives with money?
C'mon, Roi. You don't belong with them.
You are the Dark Reaper.
The Roi of now doesn't do such things!!
The past is the past!!
Do you really think so?
The past is a mirror, reflecting your future self.
Like how all those townspeople died...and like how Brian died,
people will continue to die because of you in the future.
As long as the holy sword is in your hand, you cannot change that future.
So, let go of the sword.
Buf if I do...this world will....
If you are that worried about the world, there is still a way.
You must die.
Yes, you.
That way, the holy sword will be passed down to the true savior of the world.
You always say you would give up your life to save others, right?
The lives of everyone of this world. You can save all of them, just by dying.
Don't listen, Kasel!!
Goddess Lua.. Please protect us. Bless us with your Light.
I'm sorry, Frey. The goddess will never listen to your prayer.
You know it... but you still recite your prayers, only in habit.
Of course, you lived in the church...it's obvious you would pick up such habits.
That's not true. My faith towards Lua is real!
Yes, you resent her for real.
Much like Clause, you resent her for giving Kasel such a heavy burden.
I am you. I know everything about you.
In fact, you resent her even more than Clause does because you have to continue following him around.
That's not it. I appreciate the journey she's given to me.
*Sigh*...Frey, who would have guessed you would have become a priest.
People are impossible to understand, due to their whimsical nature.
You say you appreciate this journey, but till when?
As time goes, you will tire of it. And you will abandon Kasel.
...You're right. I've changed my mind many times in my life...and it will continue to do so.
But..that isn't the only driving force behind life.
Even if my resolve is weak, I can regain it.
The strength of strong will,
is the present that Lua has given to us!!
No.. Please don't.. Frey...
I'm done...tired...
You need to follow your heart...where it leads you...
You said you were me?
That is a lie.
One day, in the future, I may tire of everything.
Perhaps then, I may suffer like you have said.
But that time is not now. Right now...I am following my own path sincerely!!
Your evil words will no longer enter my ears.
By Lua's name, I command you. Leave now, Demon!!
Wow, telling me to leave just as I arrive is just mean, isn't it?
My, you are...
Are you behind all of this?
Nope, nope.
I just came here to see what kind of fun things were happening inside Malduk's trap, as it was starting to break down.
Malduk's trap!?
I'll tell you the details later.
The darkness failed to consume you, so it'll try to attack you physically.
Sour grapes, indeed.
Look over there!
Now, its been a long time since I had some toys to have fun with.
Fu~~~~it's been a long time since I've had such fun!
You seem to be one of the Demons, why are you helping us?
Us? Ah, are you friends with those dazed humans?
I guess I should wake them up.
Let's see~ I'm Demon, so I should do it in a Demon-like way!
I guess they'll come to if I cut your throat with this scythe, ufufu...
Wh...What...?! You Demon..!!
Damn...and I thought she was trying to help us...
My dagger will be faster than your scythe, Demon.
Success~!! Hahahaha.
Wh..what?
C'mon, see? All of you woke up!
Why would I chop up this priest lady? She's too fun!
Hmm...It seems you're the youngest human to ever make a crack in Malduk's trap.
Ah~You must be the most interesting human I met in a long time!
....Are you...Epis? The thrill seeking Demon?
Oho, you know me?
Epis!!? Wow, I get to meet Epis!! Journeying around with Kasel sure has its perks!
The Demon Hero who helped save this world 100 years ago after passing through the Gate,
only because this world was 'fun'....
Are you really that Epis??
Hahaha, you humans are really funny!
Even when your lifespans are so short, you like to remember the past.
So that...was a trap made by Malduk?
Yep.
It's a magic trap that materializes the inner darkness of any sapient lifeform, in order to corrupt them.
Malduk... How distasteful.
I agree. Still, I think that trap isn't a solo job by Malduk.
Think about it. We used to exist in a place with no life.
It's not possible that a Demon would just know how to analyze the inner darkness of a living being without prior experience.
That makes sense.
So somebody from this world helped the Demons...
Who in the world would...
The one who opened the Gate was a human.
Legend says it was some crazy mage that made a mistake...
But perhaps he was actually with the Demons...
Malduk...
He laid low for quite some time, but apparently he used this trap in Ogria recently as well.
In Ogria?!!
Yeah, apparently there was an Orc suffering a huge inferiority complex towards humans.
He was asking why the Goddess favored humans, or something.around those lines.
That makes no sense. The Goddess loves all races equally.
Excuse me, lady? I'm a Demon, so I don't know about those things.
But the Holy Sword itself is an issue.
The Orcs were proud to consider themselves the strongest warriors,
but then Lua went and granted the humans the holy sword 100 years ago.
Apparently that was a part of the issue.
So they were thinking about that...
So then the strongest warrior went and fell into that particular trap.
...Sieg?
Yeah. I think thats the name.
Ugh... So when you get caught in that trap, you turn as stubborn as a brick wall.
No need to worry, Cleo.
Your bullheadedness is already enough to give anyone indigestion and constipation at the same time.
Roi, you jerk!!
Um.. You guys...? I have a question.
I know what being stubborn or bullheaded means, even indigestion, but what is constipation?
...This....I must record this!
Demons don't know what constipation is, thus they don't have to go to the toilet...
Whoa! Hey, you!
Sorry?
You...that sword...it's Aea?!
Ah...come to think of it, you were Kyle's friend, so you would know about this sword.
You...you cute little brat.
And to think you were playing dumb while we were talking about the past before.
I just thought it would be better that the people didn't know the holy sword had reappeard,
so it became a habit not to speak of it when the topic came up.
You humans sure are a headache.
Well, that's part of what makes you interesting. Fufufu..
That trap from before...if Malduk was responsible of it,
is he still around in Galluah?
Most likely, yes.
He probably already received a report about you all from the skeletons around here.
Hm? Those Golems..they feel different from the others we've seen so far.
Do you think they still hold the power of the dukedoms of the past?
Hmm..I don't know much about the magic of that era,
but that is the most likely conclusion.
Hmm...those golems seem to be guarding that coffin.
A coffin, eh? Isn't that what you humans throw your dead into?
Those are ceremonial rites.
I'm a Demon, don't expect me to understand all your customs and courtesies.
This is the Material World, where life and death go hand in hand.
Since you are in our world, you would be expected to follow our customs.
Yeah! You're here now, so act like it!
It just doesn't click when you talk about customs and courtesies, Cleo.
Why?!
Ack!
The corpse walked out of its coffin!!
Get lost...Demons...
Eh? Why is she calling us Demons?
Oh, right. Epis is a Demon.
In that case...
Let's get out of here, Cleo. It seems this is a fight between Demon and Undead.
We have nothing to do with this.
What was that for, you jerk!
Did you forget what I did with that trap for you?
Nah, I just thought a corpse would be nothing for you...
C'mon, battles are only fun when done together!
Do you think it would be fun for me to just wait alone for my mana gauge to fill up and then spam skills?!
Ri...right.
Kuku, did Roi just get yelled at by a Demon hero?
Shut up! We don't know what this enemy can do.
Stay focused, or we may lose!
Boooooring.
Fufu, I think it's funny. See, he's trying to cover up his embarassment with a faade of seriousness!
Kyahaha, you're quite interesting! An undead using its coffin as a weapon..!
Did Malduk make you, too?
Malduk..!
Hm? She's reacting to Malduk's name.
Who...was that? I don't remember anything...I only know I must destroy Demons...
The name...Malduk....kind of familiar...
Really? We are looking for Malduk. Do you want to come with us?
Excuse me, we are not looking for Malduk.
We were on our way to the Barbarian Kingdom, it just so happened that we passed by here.
Come on~ don't be a party pooper.
If the hero of the holy sword heard that Malduk was in Galluah,
wouldn't it be obvious that he should go check it out?
Well, we didn't consider that.
But it seems we'll meet him even if we didn't want to.
Considering he even set up a trap for us...
I guess you're right.
However...I don't think letting her meet Malduk is a good plan.
Why? I think it would be a fun sight.
Malduk...I want to meet...
See? The Undead lady wants to meet him!
C'mon, lets go!
This is exciting!! I wonder what fun things will happen when they meet...
Hmm...
What's the matter?
I'd thought this undead lady was made by Malduk..
But it's odd.
This isn't how Malduk does things!
Look! I found something!
There's a name written on the coffin. 'Jane Gray?'
I suppose it's her name when she was alive.
Then..
Do you know something?
When the Demons invaded this world,
There was a particular dukedom ruled by some people named the Grays fought back against the Demons.
This lady must be part of that country.
Gray...
Then those guardian golems...
They were probably trying to guard Jane Grey as golems of the Dukedom.
Is that why Jane was hostile towards Epis right after waking up?
At that time, it was just fun to kill things here.
Well, it hadn't been long since I had received a body...
We just did anything Angmund asked of us...everything was fun.
Sorry to make you remember...
Eh, please. I'm still a Demon.
I don't feel as much guilt as you may assume.
No need for you to make that face.
For a Demon, you sure read faces well.
Come on, I lived far longer here in this world than any of you.
Facial Expressions... are easy to read. I consider myself better than most humans in that regard.
But...
This one here, even I can't figure out what she's thinking.
Malduk...!
It's been a long time~ Malduk.
You... the traitor, Epis!
Fufu, isn't it nice? Reminds me of the old times.
You...you...how did you find the holy sword, Aea?!
Eh, rather than finding it...it just came by like fate?
Fufu, even though I'm a Demon,
I sure must have some kind of connection with the Goddess of these parts, Lua.
Hmph... At any rate, I will deal with you later, traitor.
I have some urgent business to take care of.
You...are Malduk?
Yes I am, my daughter.
I am your father.
Father...
Psh...well.
Considering you are called the Father of Undead, that really isn't untrue...
However...my daughter, you have been sullied.
Who tainted you to this extent?
I...dirty...
Don't listen to that bastard, Jane!
You were a human long ago. He only raised you from the dead!
She's right, Miss Jane.
Malduk had disgraced your eternal sleep.
But... I...feel...stuffy...
I don't remember anything but the name...Malduk...
Yes, follow me, your father.
You have no one but me.
Jane, Malduk is a Demon. You wanted to get rid of the Demons, remember?
My daughter, you can eliminate the Demons anytime you want.
When you get your memory back...
if you still feel the Demons must be purged, then I will die happily by your hand.
Don't lie, Malduk!
I'll come with you, Malduk.
Good bye, everyone.
No, Jane!
My daughter, no need to be sad. You will meet them again soon.
Frey was right. We shouldn't have let Jane meet Malduk..!
Hmm. I think differently.
Thanks to this turn of events, I have an interesting hypothesis
An interersting hypothesis~!? You demon!!
No wait, you are a demon! You devil!!
How can be so hedonistic even as we lost Jane to Malduk!!
Malduk's goal from the start...was probably Jane.
Even if we didn't bring her here, Malduk would have found her anyway...
Okay, so what is this 'interesting hypothesis'?
Malduk said Jane had been tainted.
Malduk probably is the one that turned Jane into an Undead...
but it seems someone else tampered with her and overrode the magic on her body.
If that is true...does it mean it is possible to grant a personality to undead?
Perhaps.
I didn't consider that much, but it makes sense.
If that's so, I wonder who cast such magic on Jane...
Considering she remembers parts of her past...
Eh, Malduk? You were still in Galluah?
Kukuku, did you really think I'd ignore the wielder of the holy sword?
Where is Jane?
You'll meet my daughter soon.
Because you will become my sons and daughters, too!!!
That's preposterous!
Kuhahahaha, you fight well, even when you haven't completed the power of the holy sword.
As a reward, I will let you meet my daughter.
Jane!
My daughter and loyal subordinate. 'His' useful tool.
It is time to repay his grace.
This 'He' seems quite famous.
Perhaps...the Dark Lord, Angmund?
No, that's impossible. I didn't feel his power in 100 years.
In the time we existed in the World of Darkness, we could always feel his power somewhere.
I don't know if he is really dead, or has gone back to the World of Darkness,
but since he disappeared from this world, no Demon ever felt his presence anymore.
Hello, everyone.
Let's be together with Him...
Accept your death, and wake up again...
Your death...I will grant...
Wake up, Jane!!
Accept it, Cleo. Jane Gray is already a dead person.
He's right, Cleo.
If Jane tries to kill us... we can only fight her back...
No matter what...
the burden we carry now is that of the world.
Yes...
We're sorry, Jane. We can't die yet.
And more than anything, we won't become the puppets of Demons!!!
Kuhahahaha, the holy sword is still powerful even when incomplete.
But you guys are yet too weak...weak to be of help to 'Him'.
I don't know who that is, but we will never help the Demons!!
Fufu, when did I ever ask you to be of help to Demons.
Fools, who don't even know who their true enemy is..Kuhahaha.
Thank you for this sample of your strength.
I will use this experience well, in the future. Hahahaha...
*Sigh*....Not again...he ran off again!!
Jane, you're still alive!!
I'm...not..alive...
Oh, right...
So you don't want to kill us anymore..?
You rejected to become like me....
I hate you...
I don't need you all....
Is she...mad?
Hmm... I can't read her.
I guess I still have ways to go.
I doubt even a thousand-year old sage would be able to read the expressions of a dead body.
Jane, you received 'His' grace...
Do you know who that is?
Won't tell you...I hate you...
Come on, this is ridiculous...
See, Jane. I'm a Demon.
Technically, Undead are also Demons. So why not tell me?
Demon working with people I hate...I don't need you...
*Sigh*...Heroes of Light, I think we need a little time to ourselves.
Us of the Darkness need some time...to do a little bonding.
Persuade her...please.
I dunno how it will go. Well, can't be helped even if it goes wrong.
Jane Gray is an interesting one.
Even if I don't learn who 'He' is, it will be fun.
I mean, you all are fun too, but this seems a little more interesting.
Sorry, Jane. We need to go now.
When you don't feel mad anymore, I would like it if you came with us.
I'll bring her along when she stops pouting.
You were all headed for the Barbarian Kingdom, right?
In that case, you need to pass through Arrovina.
Exactly, yes.
I'll see you all later.
I'll be expecting good news.
I thought the weather would be better once we left Galluah, but it seems I was mistaken.
Because Galluah was corrupted with dark magic, light does not spread well.
Arrovina on the other hand, is naturally dim.
The rain and fog blots out the sun most of the time.
There is a theory that the elves of this area adapted to the environment,
and because of that their skin color became dark...well, it's just an unproven hypothesis.
I heard that the current King of the Dark Elves is pretty young.
Young in comparison to the general lifespan of an elf, you mean. He's still 130 years old.
I heard most of the royal bloodline died during the Demon invasion.
Only one prince made it out alive. King Temorel was 30 years old back then.
He is the current ruler of Dark Elves.
My, what a cute little turtle.
I heard turtles are really delicious when cooked well. ..
Wait...
That lion...seems to be controlled by the darkness.
It's not an ordinary lion, thats for sure.
Is that what a fully corrupted animal looks like?
That is a case of enhancement through complete corruption.
That is what happens when the corruption succeeds, instead of failing and turning into the Dark Disease.
I hear corrupted animals affect any other animals nearby, turning them into ferocious beasts.
Then...
We have to fight that cute turtle...
On the plus side, we can make some turtle soup...
*Sigh*...Kasel...
Considering our current goal is to reach the Aegina Desert...
Would it be faster to go north?
The land looks rather unstable around that path.
Cleo, can we fly the distance using your magic staff, like before?
I'm against that.
Fufu, Roi seemed to quite scared last time.
Well, I won't deny it wasn't very pleasant.
Also, it seemed you were having a hard time flying as it is last time.
Considering we don't know how far the unstable ground will last...
It could be dangerous to fly off without properly gauging the distance.
True. Well then, even if we have to take a longer detour, shall we walk south?
Those are... Gnolls.!
*Sigh*...what a troublesome race.
Hmm, so even Frey has a race she dislikes?
Well, it's not like I dislike them...
After all, Lua preaches; 'Condemn the sin but not the perpetrator'.
This goes for all intellectual species, not just humans...but.
Those Gnolls are just really hopeless..
Gnolls are naturally greedy and savage.
During the Demon invasion, while all the other races were busy fighting against the Demons,
the Gnolls took advantage of the chaos and went about looting and plundering.
Hmm... Roi. Despite your general stupidity, you seem to know a lot about the Gnolls!
Um...Actually...I used to have do business with the Gnolls often.
Considering they fight between themselves all the time as well, there were a lot of assassination requests.
Uh....sorry...
Don't be.
It's me who should be thankful for all of you, putting up with me despite my dark past.
...Uh, what's with this atmosphere?
Eh...um...well. Even though we know you aren't a cold person...
It's my first time seeing Roi... expressing his appreciation.
...Is it?
Yeah, Roi. Be thankful about stuff more often!
You scared me for a second there!
Eh...sorry, I guess?
Haha, humans!!
Kyakyak! Cough up all your valuables or die!
*Sigh*....Frey was right... They really are hopeless.
And the mood was just so good...what a waste.
Hmm, it's odd that the Gnolls are this active around this area.
They may be brutes, but considering their lack of intelligence...
What are the Dark Elves doing? This is their land, Arrovina...
Perhaps...there are some ongoing issues.
Perhaps this will be a harder journey than expected.
This is all because of Roi's acrophobia!
No, its because your flight magic is lacking.
*Sigh*...and we had such a good mood going...
The Gnolls ruined everything!
Look..!!
A Dark Elf is surrounded by Gnolls!
We should save him, Kasel.
Excuse my belated apology.
Shoot, we missed him.
You, outsiders.
Oh, yes, we are...
For helping a wanted criminal get away, we banish you from Arrovina.
What? No way..!
Ugh..
Who's there?
Criminal, hah! What a load of crap. Shame on you!
Ugh!!!
Die!!
Hmph, you won't kill me with that kind of aim.
I will remember your face.
Tch, bastards.
Outsiders. The Arrovina that was ruled by Dark Elves is done for.
You better leave now.
...What just happened?
The situation seems to complicated.
We should go, fast.
The Dark Disease...!
I see...so that guy was speaking the truth.
Yeah, the Dark Elves wouldn't just leave infected animals about in the open.
What has happened to Arrovina?
Treants? This is not a forest, why would they even be here?
That is..a corrupted Treant.
It must have lost its way and wandered all over here.
Hmm...did it come here from Elidora?
No, this Treant must have been corrupted hundred years ago.
Aren't Treants intellectual life-forms?
I thought it was impossible for sapient beings to be corrupted...
There are some Treants that start losing their intelligence after a certain age.
Those Treants usually go into a deep sleep, not unlike hibernation.
Angmund then inserted the soul of Demons inside those sleeping Treants.
Angmund, that bastard.
What a cruel thing to do!!
We can only help them...by returning them to their slumber.
Goddess, Lua. Please embrace the spirits of the forest we return to you.
Kyakyak! Look at yourselves! That's what you get for underestimating us!!
Now, die!!
Stop!!
Eh? Who are you?!
Mind your own business. Or do you want to become our food?!
They won't stop even when told to.
Hmph! I'll make you regret even being born!!
Thank you, kind travellers.
How did Dark Elves have trouble with mere Gnolls?
I've heard that the Demons are backing the Gnolls.
Hahh...Gnolls again..
What has brought you all to in Arrovina?
We are on our way to the Arrovina Desert.
I see. As a show of gratitude, please let us show you the way.
We must go South.
Follow us.
Wait...Aegina is supposed to be westwards.
The Gnolls have taken over the path, besides all the corrupted wildlife.
The path south is far safer.
Go on ahead. We will catch up soon.
I don't know if we should follow them at all.
Even if the Gnolls are backed by the Demons, it doesn't make sense for them to be as active as they are.
Also....the case with that 'criminal'...everything is just so fishy.
It also doesn't make sense that the Dark Elf from before tried to banish us from Arrovina off the bat.
The west is close to the forest, however. It is probably true that it is dangerous.
If both ways are risky, it is better to follow the Dark Elves.
We have a better chance in open areas.
Alright. Let's do that.
Everyone, just be on your guard.
Wait...this feeling...
Cleo.. Can you feel it, too?
Yeah, its the same feeling that I had in Ellidora..
It's a magical power just like the Nucleus of Darkness.
Dark Elves, how many of those things are in Arrovina?
The power is similar to that of the Demons.
Tch, you found out.
So you show your true colors.
I have no clue what you came here for, but if you know about these wards...you must die!!
Hmph, you fight well.
I apologize for telling you to leave Arrovina. I underestimated you.
Can you tell us what has happened?
Why are the Dark Elves utilizing the power of Darkness?
The Ward you just destroyed was built by the order of the new Queen, El-Rosed.
A Queen?
The Royalty Palace has gone mad. It's totally out of control.
A Queen...? That's kind of confusing.
Communication with the outer world was cut ever since the Queen ascended to the throne.
Where is King Timorel..?
Hmph, that coward must have run away a long time ago.
He was too young when he became king, and he was always terrified of the Demons.
When the rumors about the Demons reappearing started circulating, he went mad.
He sacrificed many of his people to the Demons just to keep himself safe.
That's crazy!
How did that happen?
Even as he sacrificed his people, another one claiming to be of royal blood appeared.
Her name was El-Rosed. King Temorel passed on the crown to her immediately, and then fled.
However, nothing changed.
She went on to install strange wards all around Arrovina, controlling those idiots.
It doesn't quite look like they are being controlled.
I mean, when this happened in Elidora, they were killing each other...
Perhaps its more alike the trap we've seen in Galluah...
Sieg looked fine on the outside, remember?
The Queen...may not be true royalty.
At any rate, the wards seem to make the Dark Elves blindly loyal to their queen.
Do the Elves of Arrovina know that King Temorel has sacrificed his people to the Demons?
Only the soldiers involved would know.
Then how do you know?
After there were Demon sightings reported, I was dispatched to the Aegina Desert.
I was taken prisoner, but a woman named 'Maria' told me about all this.
Maria..!!
Do you know her?
An ill-fated relationship, if I ever saw one.
Where is that witch?
She saved my life. If you have a bone to pick with her, then I don't see why I should tell you.
Although, if you help me...I'll at least consider the notion.
What is it that you want?
Well, nothing much. You just have to fight the Dark Elves with me.
Also, don't ever think of going north. It's too dangerous.
Is it because of the Gnolls and the corrupted wildlife?
Did those cowards make up those excuses?
The Queen is hiding herself behind her army.
That's another reason nobody outside of Arrovina knows much about this issue.
Anyway, the reason I said it's dangerous up north is because of Black Thorn Fortress.
The Queen must have already heard the news about you,
and the soldiers around the fortress will try to stop you.
Fufufu, so many idiots, just asking to be killed.
There is no need to kill them. We'll merely be making our way through them.
Hmm, are you saying you can win without needing to kill anyone?
Lets try to keep the number of casualties to the minimum.
Or, our Priest will...
Hah, I see. Minimal casualties, you say...
Die, filth!!
Kugh..!!
You swine, you dare sell out your own race just because of an idiot's royal decree?!
Even death is too good for you!
Stop, Dimael!
You're going too far against people who have already lost any means to fight!
Hah. I'm just keeping casualties to a minimum, right?
But you're finishing them off when you don't need to!
If that's how you are going to do things, leave us. Or do you want to fight us this time?
Then you won't hear anything about Maria.
We don't need to.
If we let these elves live, they'll just report everything to the Queen, and they'll be back with bigger reinforcements.
Don't say 'We'.
We don't want to be involved with a cruel person like you.
And I tried to warn you, but you cut me off.
Our Priest is quite scary, you know.
I don't understand you. Why do you leave risks as such behind?
It is me who can't understand you.
Why are you so eager to kill your own kind?!
We'll talk about this later.
The reinforcements are here.
As things have settled down a bit, I think it's time for a little talk, Dimael.
Hmph, and you were all so eager to leave me just a while ago.
Well, you probably have your reasons.
Like perhaps someone close to you was sacrificed to the Demons.
...I guess I was right.
I thought you said people with no ties were the only ones selected as sacrifices?
My records say I was killed in Aegina.
So Epigael... my sister and only family was...
So your sister was sacrificed to the Demons...
Yes. At first, I didn't understand what this 'sacrifice' meant.
I thought I could find her. Get her back.
But...what the Demons wanted was to create Undead. Sacrifices...meant dead bodies.
Undead...
Malduk, that bastard..!!
I see...sorry for being so harsh with you.
But Dimael, hatred will only ruin you.
Hah! What's left to be ruined? I have nothing left.
100 years ago, I lost my parents to the Demons. Now, my only sister was taken by my people.
Every night, I can't even sleep because I fear seeing Epigael's undead form in my dreams.
Revenge...is all I have left.
So, how will you avenge yourself? Are you just killing every Dark Elf you see?
Hah, no.
I will kill all soldiers that blindly follow the orders of the Crown. Those swine deserve to die.
Did you feel any better killing them?
No. It's not enough, just slaughering worthless swine.
My final goal is to destroy the Royal Crown. I thought you all could help me with that.
We can't help you with that.
If your goal was to save your people from the Darkness, we would give it our all.
However, we cannot interfere with your country and its politics.
I already told you.
The Queen may not be of true royalty.
That coward, Temorel, was probably tricked by her.
So are you saying El-Rosed is possibly a Demon?
Well...we'll need to meet the Queen if we want to know about that,
You don't have a choice anyway. If you know about those Wards, there is no way she'll let you be.
Hah, serves them right.
That's what happens when you get corrupted and fool around.
The Dark Elves from before said the Gnolls were allied with the Demons...
We can't trust them word for word.
Dimael. Do you know anything about the Gnolls joining forces with the Demons?
That's news to me.
I think...we should... talk with the Gnolls.
Frey, I think the word you're searching for is 'interrogate' not 'talk'.
If you answer us truthfully, we'll let you live.
Please, please, good Master. I will speak nothing but the truth, don't hurt me.
How did you Gnolls get powerful enough to rout the Dark Elves and take over?
Ah, ah, yes. That. A messenger of the Dark Lord came and gave us courage.
A messenger..?
Don't lie, the Demon Lord hasn't even resurrected.
Ah, ah...Then we probably misunderstood.
It may have not been the Demon Lord, but anyway it was still a Demon that encouraged us, yes!
What did the Demon say?
The Demon said the Dark Elves were weaker and that we could beat them in numbers.
And when we went and fought, the Dark Elves weren't being sneaky anymore.
Sneaky?
*Sigh*... The Dark-Elves were probably just being strategic.
The Gnolls probably consider anything beyond frontal combat sneaky and underhanded.
Anyway, we were thinking of conquering Arrovina by driving out the Dark Elves.
What did the Demon look like?
Ah, I haven't ever seen the Demon myself, I swear.
I hope you aren't lying...
Please, good Master. I wouldn't lie to you.
Well, that seems to be it.
Go. We won't hurt you.
Don't ever cross paths with us again.
Please, good Master. I wouldn't ever dare. It's just that...
the other Gnolls will probably still try to attack you...
I hope you understand that's not my fault!
Understood.
Thank you for telling us the truth.
Let's never meet again.
Yes, yes. I'll stay away, good Masters.
Th..Then... Bye..
Take care.
Typical Gnolls, weak to the strong and strong to the weak.
I guess the Gnolls did side with the Demons, but it seems they haven't been given any powers.
This is all so ridiculous.
I can't stop myself from laughing...
El-Rosed...if she was trying to control people, she should learn how to do it right...
Dark-Elves... being pressured by simple, idiotic Gnolls...
Kkkk...Hahahaahaah!! Ugh, my sides...
Dimael...
I don't get it.
The Queen, El-Rosed, who we don't yet know if she is a Demon or not, is using the power of darkness...
And the Gnolls are allied to the Demons..
But the Gnolls are attacking the Dark Elves...?
I wonder if the Demon Army is having a falling out.
After all, Maria said she didn't like Malduk back In Ogria...
Maybe its like how it was in Ogria?
Malduk trying to control King Temorel... while Maria controls the Gnolls...
Hmm.. Dimael. Did Maria ask you anything personal?
Before she told me about what King Temorel had done,
she did ask me about my family.
I see. It's highly likely then that Malduk is allied with El-Rosed.
In the meanwhile, Maria is trying to interfere with that.
Forget about the Gnolls...but Dimael, you are also being manipulated by Maria.
It doesn't matter.
All I want is my revenge.
Hmm...Frey.
Yes?
You remember I analyzed the fragments of the Nucleus of Darkness, right?
I think I could neutralize the Wards after a quick analysis of them.
Oh, Cleo. That would be wonderful!
Hmph, worthless. Don't bother.
Those wards may be the only reason we're able to deal with the Dark Elves so easily.
Neutralizing the Queen's control may make it harder to fight them.
Are you stupid? You said the Queen could be a Demon.
In that case, wouldn't it be easier for us to wake everyone up and have them fight with us?
No, they are all just targets of my revenge. I have no intention of working with them.
Dimael...
Have you ever faced your inner darkness in a dark place?
What are you talking about?
*Sigh*...so stubborn even without the help of that trap...
Dimael...he has been blinded by rage.
All we can do is hope that Lua will bless his heart with the light of mercy...
Hah. Do you really think I would even accept such light.
I have nothing left but revenge!! All I want is to kill those bastards!!
*Sigh*...it seems I've failed.
I think I only fanned the flames of his hate...
Well.. Can't be helped. Let's just do what we can.
First, let's break the Ward and gather the pieces.
The Gnolls have passed the checkpoint. What were you all doing!?
I am sorry...We could not stop them, there were too many.
This must be the end for our race...
This is what we get for selling out our friends and families to the Demons...
Bascos.. That topic...
Do you really think that matters at this point?!
King Temorel is missing and there's nothing we can do about the attacking Gnolls.
There is no way I can hold my head up high in front of the gravestones of our predecessors.
Normally, you wouldn't be able to do that ever since you made a pact with the Demons.
You are..!!
Dimael, returning from Aegina.
The only family of Epigael, whom you doomed to the Demons!!
Epigael...
Sorry but I don't remember that name.
There are too many we sacrificed...to remember every single person.
Hmph, then die.
Engrave her name upon your heart as you do so!!
Sorry, but I can't die yet, Dimael. Even as the end of our race draws near,
I will save my Queen.. El-Rosed!
So..this is the end...
My Queen... I have to protect you....till the end..
Quit spewing the name of some Queen whose origins aren't know.
I need you to remember Epigael's name as you die!!
I would much like to...sorry....
but I can only think of her Majesty's sad face...
Dammit, you've all been brainwashed!!
The Queen is using the power of Darkness...she may even be a Demon...
and she brainwashed you all into blinded loyalty.
She is not a Demon..
My Queen....is.....a...Dark-Elf....
Give it some thought. The royal bloodline, supposed to have died out...suddenly reappearing.
Does that even make sense?!
Even if she is not of royal blood... It doesn't matter...
I can't imagine not living for her...trying to think otherwise makes my heart ache...
I wanted to..protect her..!!
And that is what is called brainwashing!!
El-Rosed... My Queen...I couldn't keep you safe...I'm sorry...
Cmon, Bascos...
Get up. Wake up!
Stop searching for the fake queen,
get on your knees before me, and die as you apologize to Epigael!!!
May Lua's blessing...
Shut up, Priest!
Don't pray for the dog who couldn't realise what reality was even beyond death!!
Are you taking your frustration out on Frey?!
I'm fine, Cleo..
It's all my fault..that I didn't understand Dimael's feelings...
Goddamnit, what an annoying woman.
What!!?
Cleo...
...You have to thank Frey. If it wasn't for her, I'd have burned you to a crisp!!
Yeah, thanks, Frey.
I would have been burnt to death if it hadn't been for you...As if.
I need to live....for now.
Until I kill El-Rosed, who may as well be the last of the Royal Crown.
And then, I will find Temorel....and...!!
Lua my goddess, please save the poor souls...
Allow your light of salvation to touch those who died without returning to their natural state of mind...
and Dimael, whose hatred and thirst for revenge has blinded him.
Geh!! You people are!!
Kyakyakya! New meat!! I was tired of eating only Dark Elves.
You idiot! The people are very very powerful!!
Please, please, forgive us. I didn't know you would come this way...
We will leave! Right now!
No, you don't have to. We need your help, and it will be to your advantage as well.
Do you see that Ward?
That makes the Dark Elves stronger. Break it and bring the pieces to us.
Ah, yes, yes we will!
I will break them all and bring a whole bunch of them!
Roi! You can't take advantage of them like that!
Oops, I'm sorry. ..
But...it's too late.
Hmm.. This Ward seems to be of higher quality magic compared to the Nucleus of Darkness.
Really?
Isn't it easier for the controller to just completely take over minds like back in Ellidora?
Complete control uses far more mana and is easier to reverse.
As you know, Lorraine freed the Dryads from that in Ellidora.
In this case, however...even Lorraine will have trouble breaking the spell.
And why is that?
The Nucleus of the Darkness takes over one's spirit, but this Ward controls their emotions.
In Ellidora, the corrupted people lost their minds completely,
but this is different.
They are sane, but their controlled emotions force them into swearing fealty to their queen.
So its easy to return people to sanity, but emotions are harder to sway...
Yes. Kasel.
So the cases I got emotional...
were the times that the Holy Sword started emitting darkness...are these related?
Dark emotions are hard to turn around.
The pain only gets harder to deal with once their conscience steps in.
Failing to deal with that pain will paralyze reasonable thought.
Sieg... and Bascos...are cases of this, I think...
...I see.
Himmullis and Balalaika were sane back in Ellidora,
so they weren't mind controlled at any rate.
In the case of the Ward, though, there needs to be some kind of medium.
A medium?
In the case of Sieg, his medium, or rather his darkest emotions, could be attributed to his inferiority complex.
When we were trapped in Galluah, we were shown our dark sides...
Yes, that's true.
In this case, however, we don't know what the Dark Elves are shackled with.
This isn't based on magic, so it's beyond my specialty.
Anyway, it means we need to meet the Queen,
and figure out what exactly became the medium for controlling the Dark Elves.
*Sigh*...The problem is, I don't think she'll give us a proper answer.
We can't give up!
We should give it a try, and talk to the Queen first!
I find it most terrifying when Frey says we need to talk with the enemy.
Are you the people that destroyed the Wards?
...Epigael..?
Wh..What?
Is..this a dream...?
Ah.. My brother.. You are alive..!
Is this real...? Is it really you, Epigael.
My brother. I gave up my old name. My name now is El-Rosed.
What happened to you... You became queen..?
First, come with me. I will tell you everything later.
Let's get our revenge. Let's kill off every Dark Elf aside from ourselves...
What...are you talking about..?
It's all good now.... I met you, and that's all I needed.
I don't want you to stain your own hands with revenge. Let's leave this place...together.
We should punish them for what they have done to us.
Epigael.. I came all the way here to avenge your death.
It wasn't as easy. There were many times when I just wanted to die.
If you won't come with me, you must leave Arrovina.
Otherwise, you will die too.
Because all Dark Elves will die.
Epigael!!
He's...gone.
....I don't even.
Kekeh, good Masters.
Eh? What is it?
You are all our heroes.
Becoming heroes for Gnolls isnt quite pleasing.
So...we would like to repay you...
But since we don't have anything to give, we will introduce you to someone who can!
The Demons..?
So strong, and so smart, even!
Demons...this could be dangerous.
Well, it may be better to give it a try.
It could still be a trap, so be wary.
Trap? No, no, nonono. No way, good Masters.
I would never lie to you.
She will be here soon, kekeke.
You are..!!
Stupid Gnolls, ugh.
Well, it doesn't matter.
Let's see how much stronger you've become!
That wasn't bad. I enjoyed myself quite a bit.
Were you using Dimael and Epigael??
Epigael? Ah, right. Dimael's sister.
I see you've figured out quite a bit.
What are you scheming, Morrah!
I see...those two have met.
If you're that curious, we wouldn't mind a little session of information trading.
Hmph, no need. It's not my problem.
I'm done here.
Do you think Morrah's goal was having those two meet?
Hm...I don't know what she would gain from that.
I don't know either, but if the Demons know of their relationship and are trying to use that,
that wouldn't mean anything good for us. We should be careful.
I think...we still need to meet and talk with them to understand the full picture.
Cleo, are you ready?
Yeah. I was too startled a bit ago, but next time we meet, I'll be ready.
What are you trying to do?
We'll try and save El-Rosed from the Darkness.
Wait, is that possible?
Well there are two problems yet to be solved...
One, we still don't know what the medium is.
Isn't it revenge?
Well, for El-Rosed, yes. However, we're trying to reverse the power of the Wards.
So we need to know the medium used for the Dark Elves.
Hmm... I see.
What is the other?
We can't guarantee her life.
Yes...even in Ellidora,
we had to defeat the Dryads first for Lorrain to revert them back to their normal state.
We don't know how strong El-Rosed is... but we may die if we underestimate her.
Yes...so we can't guarantee anything.
Even if we fight with all our power, we can't be sure about the safety of her, or even ourselves.
Nothing to worry about, Frey.
We have the holy sword!
Sure..but I hope we dont come to a situation where we need it.
I'm not too sure what will happen...if the power breaks out while I have yet to control it...
Especially considering we did travel with Dimael for a bit...
I would not want to kill his sister in front of him.
Yeah..he may be a rude one, but that's too cruel.
Cleo, if you can defeat El-Rosed's darkness,
can you stop the Darkness flowing into me from the Holy Sword as well?
Eh, what are you saying?
That's Frey's role! She'll be sad if you rely on me for that.
Are you making excuses up because you can't?
Ugh, you idiot. The Holy Sword can't be analyzed by even the oldest of Druids!
You don't even know a bit about magic, and you accuse me of making excuses??
Haha, sorry. Well, it's just impressive that you found a way to turn El-Rosed back to normal.
I am truly sorry, grand archmage.
....I think I like it better when you fool around. Ew...
Hahah.. You two really are a good match.
El Rosed...
You are... the people who were with my brother...
Did my brother leave?
We thought he was with you...
We were here together... He left me at the end.
This is all because of the Dark Elves...the ones who sacrificed me to the Demons...
I'm sorry, I'm sorry... my Queen.
Cmon, all of you are just being brainwashed! She is trying to exterminate every single Dark Elf!!
My... my queen. We did realize things aren't as usual right now... Do they speak the truth?
...What would you say if they are?
No...you can't... My Queen..
If you believe so...kill me.
I'm... sorry. My Queen... for our race, forgive me for having to kill you.
Kugh... what is this pain deep in my heart.. I can't dare kill her..
Please..I'd rather die myself...!!
All the Dark Elves will die soon anyway.
Get rid of them. They've learned too much.
You can all die if you need to. Build a mountain of dead bodies for my sake, and stop them.
On your honor..!
Wake up! You know we have come to save you!
But I...even so...
we can't but help protect our Queen.
We can't resist it.
Her sad face breaks our hearts...
We will keep her safe no matter what, our Queen... El-Rosed!
Please...spare the life of our Queen..Please..!
Why...why are you trying so hard, for a Queen that is trying to kill you all?
I...know that she is not of royalty...
I knew from the beginning....when she returned...
She was the one I had lead...to the demons...
I couldn't resist her from the beginning...
Guilt...deep, dark guilt washed all over me...
Then, I knew. Every one of our race, even those who have never seen her before, were all like me.
Guilt was rooted deep in our hearts...
So.. please leave our poor Queen alone..let her go.
Guit...Remorse...
Cleo.
Yes. The medium...was guilt.
Everyone remembered the Dark Elves that had been killed by their own hands when they saw El-Rosed.
Thats why they couldn't help but be loyal to her.
It's exactly what that had controlled them.
Now...we can save El-Rosed from the Darkness.
If she doesn't die, that is.
Good  thing that Dimael isn't here.
Worthless, all of you. They've made it this far...
Stop them, even if you all die!
Stop!!
My brother, you have come back..!
You..you!!
Hypocrites! You take pity on us for a second, and then try to harm Epigael!!
We're just trying to save El-Rosed from the Darkness!
Free? Her? With your swords and blades?!
Uh...we have to defeat her first to...
Stop that, it's dangerous!
Epigael, come here.
I can't agree with your goals, but I will definitely keep you safe from those who try to harm you!!
Dimael...we didn't want you to show up...
Forgive us. We can't let the Demons have their way here!
Now!
Good. Come on, Frey!
Yes!!
I remember the faces of those who kidnapped me...
Guilty, apologetic expresssions...
fear and anger had clouded my eyes...
Now...I see.
Why now..
Even when they had always looked at me that way...
Epigael...
Epigael, open your eyes.
Epigael: B..brother..
Epigael: What have I...
Dimael: It's fine Epi... We had no other choice...
Epigael: Yes... but they were suffering, too...
Epigael: Not only the king Timorel..
Epigael: Everyone were afraid of another tragedy...one like 100 years ago...
Epigael: I...felt the same.
Dimael: That doesn't mean their sins disappeared.
Epigael: And neither...have mine.
Dimael: Yes.. My sins, as well.
Epigael: Do you think we can forgive ourselves? Would we be able to forgive each other?
Dimael: We should try, Epi. We all have to try...
I'm sorry I spoil the mood, but do you intend to beg the Dark Elves for their forgiveness.
Yes, we are.
I disagree.
Too many were lost.
When they figure out El-Rosed was not of royal blood, who knows what may happen.
What happened to King Timorel?
I...killed him.
Nobody of the Royal family is left, and Arrovina is a mess.
Meanwhile, the Gnolls are massacring your race.
It's all my fault...I stopped them from fighting properly,
and let the Gnolls take over Arrovina.
Then are you aware of Maria or Morrah?
I have never heard of them before.
Then who corrupted you with the darkness?
When I was kidnapped, I was taken to a Black Knight.
A large, deep Darkness pierced my very being...
I passed out as the Darkness ravaged my soul,
and when I came to...I was already a slave to the Darkness.
A Black Knight...if he used the power of Darkness, it would be a Demon...
Actually...
He was neither Demon nor Human.
He was ominous and frightening...but irresistable.
...Some mixed breed of Human and Demon?
I've never heard of such beings.
Did the Black Knight tell you to use Gnolls?
No, that was my idea.
I thought if the current situation of Arrovina was known to the outside, it would bother 'His' plans...
so I thought this was the easiest way to get rid of my kind.
So 'He' was the Black Knight..?
Yes.
Hmm.. Then the 'He' Himmullis mentioned must also be the Black Knight.
Is the 'He' Malduk spoke of also...?
Not sure. This 'He' thing is just a pronoun. We can't judge without context.
Why was Morrah here, then?
Perhaps she is with the Black Knight. Or, she was trying to help with El-Rosed's plan.
We can only make assumptions with what we have...
Were you headed to Aegina?
Yes. You said you were dispatched to Aegina before, Dimael?
I wouldnt recommand the place. There is a reason I was almost killed.
Aegina is overrun with Demons.
Even more reason for us to go there.
So...I guess your sword is Aea.
How did you...
I will help you. I know Aegina better than most other people.
However, give me some time...I want to spend some time with Epigael first.
Hmph, don't bother. I don't care about you.
I'm really sorry for being rude all this time. From now on, I will treat you properly as an archmage.
Really..? Then...
Go ahead..
I will join you soon.
What about Arrovina?
As long as nobody reveals the truth,
I am the Queen of Dark-Elves, El-Rosed.
With this position...I will try to fix what I have done.
That's the best solution for now.
I pray for Lua's blessing to be with the Kingdom of the Dark Elves, Arrovina.
Finally, the Aegina Desert.
The Barbarian kingdom was located within the Windland Snow Mountains, right?
The mountains are straight up north, but blocked off by a gigantic cliff.
The only way to get there is through the Dragia Volcano.
*Sigh*...Seems we still have quite the journey ahead of us.
The Dragia Volcano should be west of our location.
Dimael said Aegina was overrun by the Demons...
Lets be careful.
Well, about those Demons running wild in Aegina...
I don't see any.
I wonder if it's because we've just entered the Desert.
Perhaps the Demon Army moved somewhere else?
It's been a while since Dimael returned to Arrovina, after all.
Let's be careful, just in case.
....On that note, I sense an odd presence looking this way...
Who's there!!
Hey! Don't turn around!
...A girl?
*Sigh*...and things were just getting good...Still!
Even his face is so handsome~!!
But, but, the rear view was...wait, stay still for a second.
On top of that, so cool~! What a great catch.
Treating people like objects is rude, you know.
Sorry, sorry~ I've been working as a mercenary for so long,\nI just kinda go ahead and evaluate people.
A mercenary? Who hired you to come all this way to the Desert?
Umm...right now, I don't have any contracts. Want to hire me?
I'll give you a discount!
No.
Hmm...will you be able to refuse after seeing my skills? C'mon, lets go. I'll show you!
No.
Hehe, then go on ahead first. I'll just...enjoy myself a bit more. Hehe...
Heh, Roi...looks like you better let her hang around you rather than...you know!
