*Sigh*...another weirdo.
Hmm, only scorpions and Muhrooms...well, it'll have to do.
Now, behold the skills of Reina, the Lightning Flash!
Your name was Reina, right? Your skills are quite impressive.
Hehe, thanks for the compliment.
Still, if anything...I would like to be complimented by this handsome gentleman~
Got a name, mister?
You might have figured already, but we don't need any mercenaries.
While I acknowledge your skills,\nI feel no need to give my name to a stranger, as we will part ways soon.
His name is Roi.
*Sigh*...Cleo...
Fufu, no way I'm letting a girl so interested in Roi just leave like this.
Hehe, so will you hire me?
Nope!
Eh?
As Roi said, we don't really need any mercenaries.
If you don't have anything to do, let's travel together for a while\nWe'll provide the necessary provisions.
Hmm...well, it is quite boring to travel alone.
Still, just joining like that goes against my pride as a mercenary.
Well then, take Roi.
Who gave you the right!?
Hmm...well then, what about this?
I originally went to Orvelia to get a contract, but there were no good jobs.
So I came all this way to Aegina because I heard someone else was hiring mercenaries.
So you've visited Orvelia.
Eh? Who are you? Since when were you there?
Uh...I was here all the time...
Ah, ok. Hi then.
So, where are you all going?
We're headed towards the Dragia Volcano to find a way into the Windland Mountains.
Well, we seem to be headed in the same direction.
After all, my employer-to-be is supposed to be located somewhere\naround the West of the Desert.
Eh? Goblins and gnolls, together?
In the Desert, too...
Ack! Humans! Cough up, now!
Wow. Seriously. Goblins, threatening me, the Lightning Flash?
I'll make you regret this.
If you won't cough up, we'll make you!
Hah, try it! You dared threaten an archmage. My flames will punish you all!
...Wow, there is actually someone in this world on the same wavelength as Cleo...
Kekeke,  I'm so sorry, so sorry, noble Masters...
Yeah, that's how things should be.
You guys don't live here in the Desert. Why are you all here?
Us, Pirates!
Pirates? In the desert?
Ach? Pirates cannot in Desert?
You idiot!! Pirates are supposed to sail the Sea!!
But you're all in the Desert right now.
Please, please, good Masters...we...kind of have our own issues...
We will go to the Sea eventually.
We just need some money to do so...but then, you know...
So you're robbing people in the Desert in order to get a boat and be pirates?
By the name of Lua, if you don't stop...
Aaah! Please, please forgive us, dear Masters.
We'll stop robbing people and go back home...
Ach, leave now, before they change mind!!
I dunno about the goblin...but wouldn't it be dangerous for the gnoll to return home?
I believe in giving everyone a chance.
Of course...as long as it doesn't put us in danger.
C'mon, hand over everything you have! Or should I just eat you, eh?!
Captain tell us steal, not eat!!
Dammit, you dumb goblin! Don't you know anything about threatening people?!
More robbers...
Ah! Please, help!!
Hahaha, what good luck! We'll make a killing today.
Nope, you're really unlucky.
Bullying such a cutie in front of me is worthy of punishment!!
Keke! Run! You, Captain won't forgive!!!
At this point, I'm just curious who's in charge of all these goblins and gnolls.
Are you ok, cutie?
Thank you for saving me.
Wow, your smile is so~~ cute. What's your name?
Ah...it's Adin.
Ew...I thought she was only interested in Roi.
What a flirt.
I see~ Adin, it's dangerous to travel alone in the Desert.
Come with big sis~ I'll keep you safe day and night!
While I dunno about day, I can't really say the same for night.
Why are you alone in this dangerous area?
Wow, Roi~ Are you putting your guard up because I'm showing interest in Adin?
You wish.
Cool as always~ Well, that is your charm point!
So, anyway...what's little cutie Adin doing alone in the Desert?
I'm searching for the hidden treasure of the Aegina Desert.
Treasure? What kind of treasure? Is it some kind of magical device?
Um..no, just stuff like gold.
Eeh..what a disappointment.
Eh? Well, as travelers, don't you need a lot of gold?
Like, you need it for all sorts of things, especially related to equipment...\nand it's good to be rich.
Um..yeah, that's true, but I don't want to waste time looking for some hidden treasure.
I mean, there are many other ways to make money, right?
So, any clue where this treasure is?
No, I haven't figured out the exact location yet...
Is that so? Well then, why don't we gather intel together?
Eh? Is that ok?
I agree.
That's some quick decision making there, Roi.
Hmm...I wonder if Roi prefers Reina sticking around Adin?
Roi, does interest from a woman other than Cleo make you uncomfortable?
*Sigh*...Frey, stop trying to couple me with Cleo.
I'm just a bodyguard doing his job.
Yeah, Frey. Stop trying to pair me with Roi.
Are you the naughty children that bullied my boys?
Eh? Is that child the so-called Captain of those gnolls and goblins?
It appears to be so.
I won't forgive you for raising your hand against the Miruru Pirates!
Eh? You're Miruru?
Dammit, there go my plans.
Have you heard of Miruru from somewhere before?
Nah, it's just that the person hiring mercenaries was named Miruru.
To think it was a pirate. And a child at that, too...
What? How could you not know the great Pirate Empress, Miruru!
Pirate Empress...?
Oh, come to think of it, I've heard about this before.\nThe Pirate Empress of the Seas, Miruru.
She disappeared at some point...but I never knew she was a kid.
Hmph, disrespectful brats. I'll stuff you full with my special cannonballs!
Huh, you all fight quite well!
OK, I'll accept you all as underlings!
Hah, I wouldn't join a pirate crew loitering around in the Desert if it was the last thing I did.
Well, if it was lead by a big, tough and cool man I could have at least considered it...
Ahh ahh, I can't hear you, you're all my underlings now! That's final!
No.
Nngh, I'll keep stalking you till you say OK!
*Sigh*...No sight of the Demon forces, and just a bunch of weirdos everywhere..
Well, we can't stop her if she says she'll follow us...
OK, Miruru. You can follow us, but you must stop robbing people.
If you rob anyone else, we will be enemies again.
Ok, ok. Now then! Let's go, my minions!!
We aren't your minions!
Kekeke, to think mere gnolls and goblins are invading our territory..
Kyak... damn...but...Captain forgive you not!!
Ca...captain!
Grr, you lizards...how dare you bully my underlings!
I, the Great Pirate Empress Miruru, will not forgive you!
Kekekeke, Pirate?
Hey, hey, did you hear? Pirates! In the Desert!
And the brat is the boss of Goblins and Gnolls! Gahahaha!!
What...these idiots...
No need to cry, Miruru. Pirates and robbers are evil,
but leading a number of different races isn't easy.
You have accomplished that difficult task.
Re..really?
Why can't I bring myself to believe she's really the Pirate Empress Miruru...
Th..thank you, Frey. I won't cry anymore.
I swear this curse affected my psyche as well...I keep acting so childish.
A curse?
Well, I found a treasure that grants eternal youth...
But it was cursed, and I turned into a kiddie!
Ki..kiddie??
Hehe, Frey~ Since I was cursed, you're the firstie to acknowledge me~
Huggies?
I...no...Dammit! Hey! Your minions were bullied by those lizards!
You need to avenge them!!
Ah! Right, right. Damn lizards, I'll introduce your faces to my cannonballs!
Phew... successful diversion.
I'm envious, Frey. Aren't you popular?
Um..well, I don't know about being popular,\nbut it's good that we were able to help Miruru.
Damn lizards! Taste my cannonballs, and remember the wrath of the Miruru Pirates!!
Hahaha, you can't win against the Power of Darkness we obtained!
Power of...Darkness?
So even the lizardmen...
Do they have a catalyst as well?
Well, they look sane...so that's probably likely.
Perhaps there is another way to use the Darkness, a way we haven't learned of yet.
Get them, my minions!!
Uh...uh?! But I can't fight!
Don't worry, cutie~ You don't have to listen to that brat.
Little Adin only needs to listen to big sis~ hehe.
Just stick behind my back~
Ah, ok...
Ah! There's a treasure chest over there!!
Adin, it's dangerous to run off alone!
He...help.
Adin!!
You dare lay your hands on my little cutie..!!
Kekeke, so you're the Miruru Pirates.
Yep, we're the Miruru Pirates!!
No we aren't!!
Heh, since the boss is a little girl, I suppose this little boy is her mate.
Hey, I said Miruru isn't our boss!
Also, what kind of logic leads to that conclusion?!
He has nothing to do with Miruru either so let him go!
Ahahaha, of course you'd be mad after we kidnapped your comrade.
Ugh, do those lizards only mate when both sides are similar in size...
Well, time to go, mate of Miruru. I'm sure you'll make a pretty sum as a slave.
Wait!!
Dammit, you runt! My little cutie got kidnapped because of you!!
Hmph, why is that my fault! He ran off on his own, even though he was a weakling!
Miruru! A companion was kidnapped.
Yes, Adin shares responsibility for running into danger himself,\nbut you also played part in the misunderstanding.
Fr...Frey~ I'm sowwy...don't be angwy...
Hey, you! Stop acting all cute when you're supposed to be a Pirate Empress!
This isn't the time for all this! We have to save my little cutie!
Damn it, they got away.
Lizardmen in the slave trade...I didn't know they were like that.
Yeah, I don't know about killing, but they sure aren't the type to take slaves.
We can still catch up. Let's hurry.
Adin!!
Aah, you came!
Tch, can't be helped.
Give me back my little cutie!
Thank you for helping me.
Are you hurt anywhere, cutie?
Ah, what a relief. Your cute face is fine.
Yes, thanks to everyone, I'm fine.
Ah, and I heard a few tidbits about the treasure from the lizardmen.
Treaaasurreee~~??
Yes. Apparently the lizardmen are also searching for the treasure.
I think I may have just figured this out.
Let's go find the treasure!
Yeah! Let's go! Let's take this treasure and head out to the Sea!!!
Roi, do you know if the lizardmen have any interest in treasure?
No. While they aren't quite accepting of the other races,\nthey aren't known to be materialistic.
Sometimes there are a few odd ones...but those roam solo.
There have been no cases of groups of lizardmen\nsearching for treasure or money in the past.
I wonder if they have some kind of reason?
Well, it's been a while since anyone came in contact with them...
so there may have been some changes to their lifestyle.
What are you all doing? Let's go get that treasure!
On the other hand, they said the lizardmen have some ties with the Power of Darkness...
It seems we have reason to investigate, then.
Hey, thats...!
A dwarfish helmet!
Heave...ho!!
Miruru: Eh?
Dwarf: Who are you, and why do you interrupt my sandbath.
Miruru: Why on earth are you sandbathing all the way up to your head?
Dwarf: It's common knowledge that dwarves are closely related to the earth.
Dwarf: Obviously we'd sandbath every bit of our body.
Why are you even wearing clothes if you're sandbathing? It's a given you should be naked!
Do you really wanna see a dwarf gramp's naked body...
Tut tut, Cleo...you just don't get the charm of a dwarf.
A chubby little belly, with tight, strong muscles covering the entire body.\nAn experienced dwarf, even if he is old, is great!
*Sigh*...You...are really something.
I was just resting for a bit after mopping up some Demons, and this happens...
Demons? We haven't seen a single Demon since we entered the Desert.
Hahaha, well, I did do a through job!
From what I heard the Desert was overrun with them...
Well, that's true. Still, I was able to finish the job.
After all, most of them were just lowly undead.
That aside, what are you folk all doing in Aegina?
We're looking for the hidden treasure of the Desert!
You can just ignore that child, Master Dwarf.
We're headed for the Barbarian Kingdom located in Windland.
However, due to volcanic activity, we can't possibly cross through Dragia right now.
Haha, I see. I too came from Dragia, but can't return due to the same reasons.
Well, I've come to terms by taking a break, slaughtering demons in the meantime.
Why don't we hunt down some more while we search for safe passage?
I'm sure we'll find one sooner or later.
By my beard, is that the holy sword Aea?
Eh? How did you...
Wait... Aea? That Aea? The legendary holy sword?!
*Sigh*...again...
Well, if this isn't a joyful surprise.
I fought alongside Kyle, who also wielded that sword.
That means...you're the King of Dwarves, Phillop?
Hahaha, to think that the humans still remember my name.
Wow~ The inheritor of the Holy Sword, and the King of Dwarves, all together.
It is an honor to meet such great people.
But what business does the King of Dwarves have in the Desert...?
Psh, King of Dwarves. I'm sick of that title, so stop that.
Every time I try to leave the throne, I get re-elected.
Lazy bums. They just don't want to deal with the responsibilities.
Re-elected..?
From what I hear, the Dwarven Crown isn't inherited by royal bloodline,
but rather, they elect a King through a vote.
That's a rather interesting concept.
Ah, come to think of it. If you inherited the Sword, you too must be Ki...
Ah! I see some undead right over there. Phillop, are those the Demons you were hunting?
Hmm, yes. There were a few distractions, but since I'm all rested up - may the hunt resume!
Phillop.
Ah, descendant of Kyle.
I apologize for the inconvenience I may have caused you before.\nHahaha, I was just too happy to see you.
You're hiding the truth about your lineage, correct?
Yes, that is true. Although I was also trying to hide the holy sword...
Haha..again, I apologize.
I'm sure you have your reasons.
Like any other position, the job of a king isn't an easy one,
and it just becomes harder when you try to do it properly.
You're hiding your lineage because you have no wish to become king, correct?
For us humans,it is not right for one who is not king to even dream of the throne.
Just the thought can turn one into a traitor, a rebel.
As always, the humans and their squabbles over the crown stink of blood.
Even in Kyle's time, many wished to kill him and take over the throne...\nand Kyle had to kill all of them.
Is that true?
Haha, I guess his fame as a King of Heroes erased the bad reputation he once had.
Good to see that his image as a cold blooded murderer\nstained with the blood of his half-brothers is gone.
If only he didn't go missing,\nhe would have been able to spend the rest of his kingship happily and dutifully.
Cold blooded...? Blood of his half-brothers...?
The Dwaves under my rule have long since had ties with Orvelia,\neven before the Demons invaded this world.
Kyle was a good king, one who really worked hard for his subjects.
However, nobody acknowledged his sacrifices.\nHis name only brought jeers and insults from the populace, that he killed his family to become king.
It is regretful that it was so, considering the others had no interest\nin the responsibilities of the throne, but just its power.
They even made the first move against Kyle, attempting to kill him...
I never knew...
Well, humans don't live for too long.
I suppose the disastrous invasion of the Demons overwrote history in a good way.
It's a tragedy that those forgotten issues are trying to take place again, though.
That voice...
Reina?
Hmm..so you were royalty, huh.
Since when were you listening?
From the beginning?
After all, Kasel, I followed you here.
Ah, um...what do you need?
*Sigh* C'mon, no need to worry. I know what you're worried about.
How to say this...Kasel, you're not really my type of guy. You're...kinda boring.
Is...is that so.
I just had something to say, that's all.
You remember I said I went to Orvelia to get some contracts, but found no good jobs?
Ah, yes.
Well, they tried to hire me to kill the successor to the holy sword.
I mean, what kind of bad joke is that? Why would you hire a mercenary for a hit?
I swear the nobility of Orvelia swapped their common sense for cow manure.
Anyway, I guess it was because the successor of the holy sword is also of royalty.
The Orvelian nobilty...
I guess they knew the sword is inherited by royal blood.
Hmph, not again...when will they ever learn.
Huh, I thought you'd be more surprised? Even your reactions are dull.
Well, I was...kind of expecting it.
I heard a lot of things on the way.
Reina, could you please pretend that you didn't hear anything today?
Hmm, well, ok. But could you let me grope Roi a bit in exchange?
Uh...I don't think I have the right...
Cleo, this is...
Yeah...That's definitely the Power of Darkness.
Everyone, stop. Quiet...
Cleo. Are you sensing the Darkness from that gaudy gold-covered one?
I can't tell from this distance.
For now, I think it's best we lay low and watch.
Izakerr, I don't understand.
Since when did we care for treasure.
So...are you saying you don't like gold?
No, not that. But that's exactly what's weird.
We never wanted for such things.
We never wished for riches.
But now, we're searching for treasure like our lives depend on it,\neven while sustaining losses.
Now that I think of it, this is all really odd.
Hmph, have you grown senile already?
I'll help jog your memory.
Behold all this gold! Bask in its brilliance, its radiance and glory!
The Power of Darkness...it's growing stronger.
How...how beautiful.
Ah, I think I may grow blind. I want it. I want the shinies...
I guess Greed is the catalyst for the lizardmen.
Everyone has a desire to own what they wish for,
but greed beyond one's capabilities will only ruin people and those around them...
Now, what do you think. Don't you want to go search for more treasure?
Yes! I want more! I also want to cover myself in gold like you!
Go forth! We shall erect our own empire of gold!
Now that we know what the catalyst is, there is no need to stay in hiding.
Cleo, can we save those lizardmen from the Darkness?
Piece of cake. Well, we only have to beat up that one called Izakerr.
Good. Let's go.
Who are you.
Corrupting your own peaceful race with darkness and greed,
how could you call yourself a leader of your race like that?
You misunderstand. We originally had no leader. Everyone lived their own way.
I too lived my own life, far away from my race.
I dreamt of a better life beyond the horizon,
unlike my brothers who lived drearily with no aspirations at all.
So...that great dream was nothing more than a measly treasure hunt?
You too seem to be fools stuck in the present.
How sad, to think even the humans were afflicted with such sloth.
I have no time for the likes of you. I must go find my treasure.
Wait, that's just running away!
Well, I can understand his feelings, and the call of treasure.
Poor Izakerr.
Hm? Why would you say that...
Well, he's probably like me, and found some kind of cursed treasure in the past.
Dreaming of a better life...beyond the horizon?
I swear he has been cursed with the power of cheesiness.
Ah, I'm so sad. Frey, cheer me up, please? Huggies~
...I swear you're the cheesy one here.
Cleo, can you save Izakerr too?
*Sigh*...Frey, there's no need to take guys like that into consideration.
It would be easier to just take him out.
But...even Miruru said she felt bad for him...
Grr, don't take everything she says so seriously!
But Cleo...even so, I want to give Izakerr a chance.
*Sigh*...all right, all right. If you say so, Frey.
Let's give it a try. We've succeeded once before, after all.
Hmph, I see. Even though you said otherwise,\nI see you too were interested in the treasure here.
No, we just had business with you personally, Izakerr.
I have no idea how you learned how to control the Power of Darkness,
but that power will eventually lead you and your race to ruin.
Hmph, I won't be fooled.
This power is exactly what I need to unify my race!
No way we're talking our way through this one.
I won't let anyone else take it! The treasure of Aegina is mine!!
Just a moment, Izakerr.
We'll save you from the Darkness now.
Hmph, I refuse. Hahaha..I have no regrets.
I want to die living my life, just like this.
If that is your last wish...rest in peace.
Hmm? Wait, I don't see Adin.
Adin? Where are you, cutie~?
Isn't this bad? He may have been hurt by those lizardmen!
I saw him sneaking off while we were dealing with the lizardmen.
From his expression, I'm pretty sure he was filled with hope of finding the treasure.
What? You let that helpless child just wander off?
That's low, even if you were jealous of him.
You wish.
Regardless, everything will be fine.\nAfter Izakerr died, I'm sure all the lizardmen were freed from the Power of Darkness.
Adin won't be in any trouble.
Hmm...ok. Well, what are your future plans now?
Eh, I'll stick around Aegina for a bit longer, cleaning up any leftover Demons.
Roi?
None of your business.
We'll continue looking for a way to the Windland Mountains.
Hmm...what do I do...
I do want to follow Roi, and I don't mind following Phillop either...
Ah! Well, Adin may still get in other kinds of trouble,\nso it will be best if I go and be his bodyguard!
That's a good idea.
Haha, Reina isn't even mentioning me as usual...I feel a bit left out.
Well, Kasel, you have Selene.
That's only because of the Holy Sword.
Well...not like I was ever popular or anything.
Frey, I'm gonna go find the treasure.
After that, I'll become a truly great pirate, and come to get you.
Let's go out to the Sea together!
No! Frey has her own path to follow.
Go to the Sea on your own!
You know, you keep trying to get between me and Frey,\nand it's honestly starting to tick me off.
I was part of this party before you even showed up!
See, Kasel. Taking Frey's current predicament into consideration,
don't you think it could be better to be unpopular?
That suuuuure makes me feel a lot better.
Anyway, we really should go find a road towards the Windland Mountains.
Huh, there's a path here...
Did anyone know that this path existed?
Yes, I remember that in the past,\nthere was a path from Aegina that lead towards Windland,
but after the Dark Lord disappeared, it was sealed off.
I wonder if the reappearance of the Demons has anything to do\nwith the seal being undone.
That might be the case.
It may be dangerous...but this is probably our only way through.
Don't worry, Kasel. We've been through a lot of dangerous situations already.
Yeah, everywhere that's not home is dangerous, anyway.
Haha, well, that's true. Still, we're finally near Windland, and the Barbarian Kingdom.
I hope our journey ends soon so we could go home and sleep under a nice roof.
Great! C'mon, lets get to that Kingdom already.
Finally, Arlette...
Your child has come back.
As expected, the Desert has scorpions...
Careful, Kasel. Scorpions are rather dangerous.
Those huge pincers are rather impressive.
True...Mmm.
Roi, I think Kasel is impressed by those pincers in a different way...
Yeah, I could tell once he started making that noise.
The pincers are tastiest when it comes to these.
Let's go!
Don't get too excited, Kasel! You'll get hurt.
What heat. Can we really pass through Dragia?
Urgh, it's quite different from what it was like before...
Cleo, have you been to Dragia before?
Yeah, the first place I went to after I left the Tower was Dragia.
I came here looking for clues about my mom...
Were there none?
Yeah...that's why I went to Orvelia.
Were you planning on crossing through Dragia?
It's impossible. The volcano became active recently, it's too dangerous.
*Sigh*...What now?
What now? What do you mean, what now?\nYou should help think of a way to go out to the Sea with me!
*Sigh*...We need to get to Windland. We have no time for your games.
Well, we still have to figure out the relationship between the lizardmen and the Darkness.
In the meantime, hopefully we might find a different road -\nor the volcano may go dormant.
Everything is ruined because of you. If it wasn't for you...Kyle would have never turned out that way!!
Yes...It's all my fault...I guess...I must die...
We elves will not judge whether a single human must die or not.
However, your baby must live.
Lorraine, that woman has lost everything.
It would not be surprising if she hated even her child at this very moment.
Come. A good night's sleep will make everything better. That should be enough.
We may need the help of that child one day, as well.
Will II stop hating you once I wake up...
I can't help you live in luxury,
but I can lay my life down for you.
That is the one thing no noble or king can do for you.
That's...a tiger. A pretty big one, too.
Kasel, you were thinking you could eat your full for once if we caught that, right?
Ahaha...Frey, you know me too well.
Well, it seems the tiger is pretty hungry too.
One wrong move and we could be the ones to become food.
Hah, don't worry! One special archmage barbecue coming right up.
Hey, you! Why are you interfering with my hunt!
Eh? Do you mean us?
Yeah! That tiger was mine!
What?! Didn't you see us catching that tiger?
The tiger was moving too much because of you, so I couldn't take the shot.
Ugh...Kasel, say something.
Hmm...Cleo, let's give the tiger to her.
Eh? Kasel, are you really giving up on food?
Well, if she had her sights on it first, it can't be helped.
Wait, what about our efforts in catching it?
Cleo, we would have had to fight that tiger anyhow if we were to pass through this road.
Wow, you're all so nice. I'm Rodina, pleased to meet you. Well then, I'll be taking the tiger!
Just a second, Rodina. Do you know where the Barbarian Kingdom is?
Eh? Oh, that kingdom is no more. Anyway, thanks!
Eh? Wa...wait!
Ah...well, there she goes. Dammit.
We lost our tiger and the Barbarian Kingdom is gone...
Let's try to find some remaining Barbarians, then.
That...looks like a Barbarian, right?
Why is he fighting with the harpies?
Let's go and ask.
Humans...hmph, no doubt you're here to help the Barbarians, as kindred primates!
Eh?
Disappear!!
Wait, we wanted to talk...
I don't think that's likely.
They're attacking!
Ah...sorry, sorry. I got you caught up in my little scuffle.
It's fine. We were looking for a Barbarian, after all.
What for?
We heard that...the Barbarian Kingdom has fallen.
Do you know what happened?
I wasn't here when that happened, so i don't know the details.
However, apparently every other race on Windland is now hostile to the Barbarians.
I hear they all bonded together to overthrow the Barbarian Kingdom.
So that's why the harpies...
Weren't the Barbarians originally warring against the Frost Giants?
Yeah. The Frost Giants were the first to attack, too.
I have no idea why the other races took their side...
The war didn't make any sense to begin with.
King Musuclow, the Barbarian King at the time of the Demon Invasion,
and the Tarkas, the Frost Giant King, worked together to defeat the Demons.
If the legends are true, they were very good friends.
While 100 years have passed, even now
nobody knows why Tarkas and King Musuclow came to conflict.
Even so, it wasn't as if they actually fought back then; they merely stopped communicating with each other.
Yes, I heard Tarkas only started attacking the Barbarian Kingdom after King Musuclow passed away.
Hmm, considering Frost Giants have a lifespan that is about 10 times longer than the average human...Tarkas must still be alive.
Was he trying to honor his late friend till the last moment?
What use is all that?!
In the end, our Kingdom was destroyed by his hand.
My entire race has been reduced to living in hiding, scattered across Windland.
Now those harpies...they are hunting down every single straggler merely trying to live in hiding.
Why are they doing such a thing...
I want to know too. So much has happened while I was away from the Kingdom.
Although the others...they refuse to meet with me.
Can't blame them. From their point of view, I ditched all my responsibilities and ran away.
So, for now we have no leads on the whereabouts of the last Barbarian King...
Well, it can't hurt to try. I'll help.
*Sigh*...things just became very complicated.
I was hoping that the Barbarian Kingdom was the key
to us finding out how to recover the rest of the Holy Sword's power.
....Kasel.
What do you plan to do...after you find out how to recover its power?
I remember you said you would hold on to the Sword for the time being.
You didn't recover the Sword's Power back in Ogria.
I am not...thinking about the future, just yet.
For now, I'm just doing what I can.
I do hope some of the Barbarian royalty survived the war.
Yes. I don't know about the area above the cliffs, but down here, there isn't too much ground to cover.
As long as I know someone is targeting my life...
I can't return to the life I had before I received the Holy Sword.
Wow! Dryads, even in all this snow!
I guess the Dryads here haven't been corrupted?
They haven't been corrupted, but...
Humans?
While they aren't Barbarians, they are still of humankind!
*Sigh*...as I was trying to say,
every race here has become hostile to humankind as a whole.
What, even the nice and gentle Dryads have become your enemy?
The heck were you Barbarians doing here?
Cleo, Gau wasn't here while this all happened.
Yeah, I think we should at least know why we are being attacked.
Dryads, could you please tell us why you are hostile towards humanity?
Do you really not know.
100 years ago, humanity was the race that brought the Demons to this world
And now, they have allied themselves with Demons once again. Humans are a blight upon this world.
...Wha...what....
No. No....that can't be true.
Disappear!!
Aah, damnit! This is all so unfair!
The harpies, the orcs, the dark elves - they made deals with the Demons, not us!
It's not just the Barbarians that worked with Demons!
Who the hell would work with Demons?!
Come on, that's the only explanation for this.
The only humans that live in Windland are you Barbarians,
so if every other race turned on you, wouldn't that be why?
We don't know anything for sure, yet.
For all we know, this could be a plot to destroy the Barbarians!
He's right, Cleo. There's not enough information yet.
We need to investigate a bit further.
*Sigh*...You're right. I was just annoyed because we were attacked for no reason.
Yeah, considering what we went through to get here...it is a bit unfair.
Well, it's true that the rumors say a human opened the Dimension Gate.
Well, at this point I don't really think that was an accident anymore...
Frost Giants!!
Oh, that man is....Gau!?
We thought you were dead, since you never showed your face!
You don't seem to know each other...
Considering they know who you are, I guess you were quite famous, eh?
Stories of the past. My homeland has perished, so what use is there in past glory.
He's a dangerous one. Kill him at all costs!!
Oh, isn't that Rodina?
Ah! Hello~. Nice to see some friendly faces. Would you help me for a bit?
What's going on?
There are some Frost Giants trying to attack my residence.
I would like to discuss the specifics after we get rid of them...
Thank you, thank you.
Do you live around here?
Yes, I do,
Is that so... Could we borrow your place for one night? As thanks?
Mmm...is anyone of you named Kasel, by the way?
I'm Kasel. How did you know my name...?
Ah, so it was you people.
Let us go. There is someone waiting for you.
This is...
Is this the Sealed Ice Cavern?
Yes, it is.
You live here?
For now, yes.
I heard this place was sealed with magic for over a thousand years.
That seal was broken?!
That's just how it was known. People have been coming and going around here for some time now.
How are you so calm about this! This place is supposed to be a big deal between sorcerers!!
It was sealed by magic, and you're not even a spellcaster!
I never said I was the Master of this cavern.
Wait, you did say someone was waiting for us...
Is that person...
Yes, he's the one. Let us go.
*Sigh*...not again.
Wa..wait. This is different from the rumors!
Why are there demons here?!
Well, rumors are rumors, and quite a number of frozen bodies were just left behind over time.
Simply, they turned into undead.
We couldn't stop the power of darkness from invading these caverns.
Demons, even in these lands...what the hell happened here?
Eh? You're a Barbarian, and you don't even know about that?
Your King made a deal with the Demon, Malduk.
Wh...what? Don't lie to me!
I wouldn't lie. It's my mission keep a look out for all that happens around these lands.
I know everything that happened recently, at least.
That...there's no way...
...Could you explain in more detail.
Well, it can wait.
We should probably bury those corpses first.
Are you ready to listen?
How long has it been since you left your Kingdom?
About...10 years.
It's no surprise you didn't know what was going on, then.
When I received my mission and was dispatched to this area,
which was about 3 years ago...the Barbarian Kingdom was already in shambles.
The long war caused many Barbarian refugees to wander around,
and considering their rough, brutal nature, they survived by plundering Harpies and Dryads.
So that's why...everyone turned against us.
Not really. Those who joined in the war against humanity were not that numerous.
Still, even those small numbers made a difference.
In the end, the Barbarian Kingdom was on the brink of Ruin.
That was when Malduk visited the Barbarian King.
*Sigh*...Malduk, that name gives me the headaches now.
The rest is simple as day, I guess.
Cleo, don't be so blunt in front of Gau.
It's fine...
So thats how the Undead came to be in Windland...
Yes, that was the Barbarian King's worst decision.
It's obvious.
Everyone would most definitely turn against the Barbarians after such a decision.
If I hadn't left...maybe things wouldn't have turned out so horribly...
Gau, you had your own path to follow...
This isn't your fault.
That voice...Pavel!!
What in the world...
Rodina: Pavel!! What's going on!!
Pavel: Ugh...Tarkas...why...
Tarkas: This woman, Arlette...she's the reason Kyle turned out that way.
Cleo: Arlette...? That person is...
Wait for me, Pavel. I'll...
Hah, too late. Come, Arlette. It's time to pay for your sins.
Arlette: .....
Kasel: M...mother....
Cleo: What? Kasel's...mother? But she's un...undead...
Tarkas!!!
Guh, damn you...
We used too much power fighting Pavel.
We have to retreat for now!
Ugh, can't be helped...We retreat, for now. Take Pavel.
I won't let you!!
Arlette: .....
Kasel: Mo..mother...how...
Roi: Don't, Kasel! She's merely a corpse! She's Undead!!
Frey: No, Kasel!!
Kasel: Frey!!!
Arlette: .....
Frey: Ah....good...Kasel is...fine...
Kasel: Fr...Frey...why....
Frey: Kasel...you have to...save...the w..world...
Frey: .....
Kasel: Frey....Frey!!!
No..no...this can't be...
Wait...it seems we are the next targets.
This...can't...
Damnit...it can't be helped.
Roi: Hraaaagh!!
Roi: C'mon, all of you...get yourselves together!!
Again...because of me...
Because of me...Frey...you died because of me....
Why...why me.
The Holy Sword...I never wanted it.
I'm done.
It's all over.
Kasel.
Fre....Frey?
Why...did we come all this way.
The paths we walked...many others lost their lives. Nameless graves, unknown to anyone.
Even so, we needed to fight. We needed to protect ourselves.
This may all be one horrible excuse, but it was needed to stop a bigger tragedy from happening.
No one wanted this, but the fate of this world was placed in our hands.
But...it's all over.
What could I do...without you.
I caused many deaths...now it's simply my turn.
Kasel...
I don't want you to fall into the Darkness because of me.
My path was to keep you from being corrupted.
Please, Kasel.
Let me finish my job...stand, and fight.
Frey...
I'll try. For you...I'll stand.
Thank you.
Thank you, Kasel.
This...this is...
Frey...?
Ho..how...
Ka...sel...?
I'm...alive?
That...that's what I wanted to ask, Frey.
You're alive...right?
I think so.
Frey~~!!
They disappeared for now...but what were those wings?
Wings?
I dunno...they did look like those of an Angel, though.
But I never heard of Angels with such huge wings, nor did I know they could hide them...
Kasel...are you ok?
Yeah...thanks to you.
Thank you for being alive, Frey.
Yes.
Well, can't stay here forever.
Pavel, right? He probably knows a lot about all this.
Let's go and save him.
Rodina! Is Pavel safe?
Yes, we saved him - but we should still be cautious.
What about Gau?
He went after Tarkas.
We should deal with the Frost Giants in the vicinity first, then.
It seems we've dealt with most of them now.
Are you alright, Pavel?
Are you Kasel...what about...Arlette...
I finished her off. It was the only way.
....I see.
How did mother...turn into an Undead?
She was killed by Undead, so it shouldn't come as a surprise.
When I arrived at your village...she had already turned into one of them.
You knew her...?
Around 100 years ago...I sealed her in ice.
Around that time...she was already pregnant with you.
That...that means...
You should know your lineage now.
Eh? What? What is this about?
I...have the blood of Orvelian Royalty.
I knew I was a descendant of Kyle...
But if that was 100 years ago...wouldn't that mean...
Yeah..I guess that makes me...King Kyle's son.
Is that true, Pavel?
Yes, it is.
Why...did you seal my mother in ice?
Did she do anything wrong?
No. It was nothing to me.
When she was trying to give up on life...
I just...told her, it would all be fine after a good night's sleep.
Mother was...trying to give up on life?
What happened?
Arlette is a woman Kyle met on his journey to save the world from Demonkind.
When he left her to finish his journey, she was pregnant with you.
The Demons knew of this, and attacked her village, killing everyone.
Simply, they thought by killing everyone, they would be rid of you and her.
So how..did my mother survive?
Before Kyle met your mother, she had a fiance.
While he broke up with her for her future...
He came back to save her from death, dying in the process.
Arlette lost everything she loved. In the end, she wanted to die, hating herself and Kyle for all that happened.
I'm sorry to say this...but at that moment, she hated everything, even the baby inside her.
That was...what it was like.
Arlette...didn't love King Kyle?
I have no knowledge of their exact thoughts.
I can only know what I have seen.
Thus, my story ends there.
Thank you for telling us. It all seems very complicated...
Uh, what about my father...the man who raised me?
He wasn't your biological father, while he was your guardian.
Wait, you're human, right...you lived over 100 years?
I'll tell you about that later.
Hm. The Holy Sword's power is weak. Have you not recovered the rest of its power?
We only recovered 1 part of the power.
Yes, I heard from Lorraine. So you didn't find Aeatola's portion?
I did find it...but I decided that it was too dangerous to recover it at that moment.
I kept losing control of the Sword...
I see. Tell me if you need to recover its power.
I will return the power I hold.
You have a fragment of Aea's power?
Musuclow left it with me.
He knew that the Barbarian Kingdom would be in peril after he died.
King Musuclow...
The power of the Holy Sword was divided into 3 parts.
As soon as you decide that you are capable of controlling the power by yourself, you will be able to complete the Sword.
Is there no way to stop the Demons without doing so?
That is a useless question.
If they were so easy to stop, they would have never be a threat.
.....You are right.
The Sword is the best way to save this world, after all...
It is smart to be wary of a power too strong to control.
However, do know that it is not an issue you can put off forever.
As expected of you, Gau. I have heard rumors of you, but your skills are truly impressive.
I wanted to meet you face to face, Tarkas.
Why...why did you start war with us?
Because human greed will be the end of this world.
Barbarians were merely the beginning. We plan to wipe out the human race completely.
I won't let you!!
Hah, that was a good fight. Still, this is the end - you were no match for me.
Now, die.
Gau!!
Grrk....This...is the Holy Sword, Aea...
So you are Kyle's son.
Yes. I am the son of your friend, Kyle - my name is Kasel.
I never thought I would meet the son of Kyle here. Interesting...
I will see you later, son of Kyle.
Welcome, son of Kyle.
So you were waiting for us.
Yes. I cannot allow Aea to stay in human hands.
It is a dangerous weapon. Even more so, as it was given to greedy humans who cannot control themselves.
I will destroy everything. Humanity, and the Holy Sword as well!
Why were you after Arlette?
If you wish to know that, work with me and destroy them.
My curiosity is not worth such a price.
Hmph, you too were originally human.
Die together with your former race!
The King of Frost Giants, Tarkas...as expected, he is really strong.
So weak, son of Kyle. You disappoint me.
This is the end!!
I won't allow it, Tarkas!!
Even if it wasn't what I wanted...
If I falter here...I can't save everyone...I can't save the world!
Even if I am swallowed by Darkness once more, there is no other way!
Pavel, the time is now! Return the power of the Holy Sword to me!
I see. As agreed, I return the power to its rightful owner.
I feel it...the holy power welling up inside the Sword...
Gugh...
So you were the inheritor of the Holy Sword...
So this...is as far as I go...
Lua...why did you give the Sword to the humans...
So fragile...so weak...so unstable...
Is it over...
If you are speaking of Tarkas, I would say so.
Thank you, Pavel. We are all fine, thanks to you.
No, it is because you decided to do what must be done.
Gau, considering Tarkas has fallen, the remaining Barbarians must be safe, right?
I'll still try to convince the other races, to make sure of things.
When you try to speak with the Harpies, tell them this.
The Harpies back in Elidora, to the southeast of this place
also made a deal with Demons in the past, so they shouldn't be too harsh on you.
Haha, well, I'll see what I can do.
Now, only the power with in the talisman of Aeatola remains.
Then, the Holy Sword will be whole again.
Kasel, will you recover the last portion of power?
Frey, you tried to do your part even through death.
I should...do what's right. Even if it scares me.
What's so scary? We're all here with you.
Thanks, Cleo.
I suggest heading to the Dragia Volcano first, before that.
Have you heard that the volcano has become more active recently?
Yes.
It is probably due to a large Dimensional Rift occuring at the site.
A Dimensional Rift?
Ever since the Dimensional Gate opened 100 years ago, small Rifts occured here and there.
Is..is that so? That's...that's really dangerous.
So far, only small Rifts occured...but this time, the scale is different.
Considering the volcanic activity has calmed down to a certain extent...you should be able to enter the area.
For protection, I will grant you a shield of protective Frost Magic.
After everything is over, I'll meet up with Lewisia and help you with your journey.
Thank you. We'll head over to Dragia first, then.
Huh, why is a child just walking around here in the open?
Is there something wrong?
It's dangerous. The enemy is targeting all humans, remember?
I don't think she's particularly in danger.
Well, she is young and alone...that could be dangerous potentially.
Still, after Miruru and Rodina...I don't think she'd be in that much trouble.
Hey, it's dangerous around here.
Eh? You are...
Wait...have I seen you somewhere before?
It's been a while, Gau.
You are...Lei?
Hmm, I guess they know each other.
Considering you are here...has the orphanage shut down?
Irin is in charge of it.
Wait...you haven't grown at all!
Indeed.
I mean...considering the time that has passed, this is a bit...
Lei...was it? Are you also...cursed?
What do you mean, cursed?
Well, we met this kid in the Aegina Desert, named Miruru.
She apparently was under a curse that turned her body into that of a child.
Hahaha, no, it's not a curse.
Hmm...Well, it does seem different.
I swear Miruru's mind also reverted to that of a child, but...this...
Lei...was different from the other children. She was calm, more mature...so she stood out.
I was worried, Lei. You left behind nothing but a letter.
Well, it's a relief you're safe and sound.
Uh, you mentioned an orphanage?
Gau built an orphanage for children orphaned from wars.
He may look rough, but he's a caring man.
War orphans...
Many children were orphaned in the war with the Frost Giants.
I couldn't just leave them unattended.
So you were away from the battlefield to tend to the children.
But...perhaps that caused even more people to die...
That's not true, Gau.
Even if you did fight on the front lines, nothing would have changed.
I guess so, Lei. Thanks.
It's dangerous here, so lets go.
Haha, it's fine, Gau. I have some business to attend to.
See you later, then.
Lei!!
Oh, that stubborn child...
I don't think you need to worry that much, Gau.
Considering her growth and all, I don't think she's a normal person.
Lei?
Ah, the people from before.
So you're with the Ice Dragon.
Ice Dragon?
Who are you? I think I've seen you before...
Hm, I see. You wouldn't recognize this form, after all.
Ice Dragon....I guess you're talking about Pavel?
Hmm...Ice Dragon, you haven't told them about your identity yet?
I only spoke about what was needed.
It seems I am not the only one who hasn't revealed their identity, though.
Haha, no need to be so wary.
Still...we need to hurry.
Gau can't beat Tarkas on his own.
You even know Tarkas...who are you?
That can wait. For now, we must hurry.
You will know in due time.
No!!
Sorry, but I need to stop you there, Tarkas. He's a friend of mine, after all.
You...Lewisia!!
Hmm, not bad.
I was worried for a second about what would happen if I wasn't able to unlock my power.
Hm, so it was Lewisia. No wonder I thought you looked familiar.
Lewisia...wasn't that another of King Kyle's companions?
Yeah...the Vampire, Lewisia.
How did you suddenly turn into an adult?
This is her true form. I am more curious about why she turned into a child.
Lewisia, you...
I understand why you hate the humans, Tarkas...
But the world is in danger, and this is no time for you to vent upon the humans.
You don't understand anything, Lewisia. Everything that went wrong is the humans' fault!!
And yet, it is also the humans that were tasked with ending the conflict.
Lua decreed so, Tarkas.
....Point taken.
Still....
No, it can wait. I will retreat, for now.
...Gau?
Ah...what...what is going on....
Are you really...Lei?
I was using a false name just in case of trouble.
My real name is Lewisia.
100 years ago, I used too much of my power. Now, I am limited to this childish form.
I unlocked my power temporarily to save you,
but I will soon revert back into my younger form.
....So you were a hero. A savior of this world.
I didn't want people to know that, it would just be a bother.
I just wanted to mingle normally with people.
Why?
So you could...drink their blood?!
*Sigh*...Well, vampires don't only drink blood.
It is true that blood makes us strong, but we do not thirst for it.
Anyway, I only wished to observe the humans while wandering carefreely.
I wanted to see them rebuilding this world after all that had occured.
Apparently, though, those carefree times are now over.
Is that not so, Child of the Holy Blade.
I guess you would have known.
Do you know who is leading the Demons this time?
No...but, we do have a lead.
Apparently it's not a demon, nor is it a person of this world.
Someone called the Black Knight.
Yes. It seems that Tarkas is helping the Black Knight.
What?! That means he's made a deal with the Demons!
What a hypocrite, blaming humans for everything while he's...!!
Although...
it seems the Demons are not involved whatsoever in this situation.
It does seem that they have some internal...issues.
Is that why he was after Arlette.
Arlette? A human like her couldn't be alive after all this time...
Wait, Pavel. Did you do something?
I'll speak about that...later.
I explained the whole thing to these people just a bit ago.
So the fact that my mother was put into a cold sleep wasn't common knowledge between the heroes...
Hmm? She was your mother?
I see...so she really was alive.
Not...anymore.
Anyway, we need to stop Tarkas for now.
It would be nice if everything could end after a nice conversation, but that doesn't seem possible.
Well, it was always like this. Right, Frey?
Sadly, yes.
I won't be of much help, anymore. My strength is all gone, and I will soon become a child again.
I will need some time to recover, and then I'll join you all.
After I do, I will need your help to return to my prime.
So, you are here.
I hear you're allied with the Black Knight.
You know he's in charge of the Demons, right?
You know of him?
Not much?
All we know is that he's in charge of the Demons.
And you have the gall to say that the humans are the cause of all this strife?!
Hmph, you know nothing.
Now...die before you learn anything more.
Let me ask one last thing before we fight.
Not bad for a squire. Still, I can't help but notice...
Um, is something wrong?
Your sword. It's too worn out to use in battle.
Oh, I... didn't realize that.
I wonder if I can get a new one from the store.
No need to go back. Just take mine.
Thank you, but... I don't know how to use daggers.
Tsk, tsk. Didnt you know you could gain loots during the adventure?
Even if you don't need it, you can always sell it to make a few extra gold!
Cleo's right. Here, I think these swords might be useful to you.
Wow, two swords? Thank you, Roi.
It's not high in quality, but it'll do for now.
Don't worry, we can always try enhancing them.
At the forge? Guess we'd be going back to Orvel after all.
Roi, you idiot!
I've heard of gear enhancement before.
It's when priests upgrade gear using other gear as material, right?
That's correct.
Ooh, I've always wanted to try that! Teach me how!
Um... this is a different kind of magic than the spells you usually use.
Can you at least tell me how it works? Please?
It's my duty as the great sorcerous to at least learn the theory.
Lua is the goddess of light and creator of all.
Though creation is beyond our abilities...
As Lua's disciples, we are capable of merging gear with similar mana flows.
Right, and gear used in battle usually have similar mana flow.
But I've heard that there's a chance of failing if your stream of consciousness slips off.
Don't worry. Even though I'm still an apprentice, I've never failed in gear enhancement.
I guess becoming a priestess is my calling.
Oh, this is much better than the sword from before. Thank you so much, Roi.
Hahaha, you don't have to thank me for it.
It's not the best sword in the world. I'm actually worried that it's not high enough in terms of quality.
Don't worry, I can always enhance it.
I guess we should go to the Forge, after all.
No, you fool!
I heard there's a way we can enhance weapons without going to the Forge.
If I remember correctly, a priest can pray to the goddess and enhance weapons.
Yes, that's correct.
I've been curious about it for a long time now. What is the magical logic or principle behind Enhancement?
Um... It's very different from the spells you usually use...
Can you at least tell me how the system works?
People call me an Archmage. It would be a shame if I didn't have any theoretical knowledge about it.
Lua is the goddess of light and creator of all.
Her servants, priests, and priestesses cannot create something out of nothing,
but they are able to bless objects with the power of Lua and imbue them with more strength.
It's a simple blessing, even for an apprentice priestess like myself.
It sounds both similar and different to alchemy.
Alchemy consumes plenty of materials, but it is for adding and changing attributes of an item rather than enhancing the item itself.
Do priests need any materials when performing Enhancement?
Oh, we don't, but we do need to offer Lua a certain amount of Gold.
According to the High Priest, that is how we express our gratitude to the goddess.
...Umm, that sounds awfully practical and realistic.
Participating in battle is really helping me with my combat skills.
You shouldn't be neglecting your studies though.
Ha ha, of course.
I was planning on reading the warrior skill book to learn attributes just now.
Hmm, I can't seem to find any useful loots around here.
I know, right? All I found was this glittering rubbish.
Oh, Cleo, that's...!!
Huh? Is something wrong, Frey?
That's a summoning stone!
With the help of Lua, we can summon powerful gear using that stone.
I knew it! A great sorceress is bound to attract great items!
A great sorceress would probably recognize a summoning stone.
Sh...shut up, Roi! You know this is the first time I've seen a summoning stone!
Cleo isn't a priestess, it's natural for her not to know.
Since Cleo is the one who found the stone, I'll try to summon a wizard's gear.
Welcome to May's General Shop!
We have weapon and armor that will suit a young, handsome knight!
Runes and magic powders are ready too, all just for you!
I hope you find what you need.
But if you browse and leave without buying anything...
May will be very disappointed!
Heh. Looks like you have no choice, Mr. Young, Handsome Knight.
Ahahaha...
Roi, is something wrong?
I don't understand.
There are demons on the loose, but people only seem to care about the ancient royal vault.
Maybe the Orvelian Royaty doesn't know about the demons yet?
Probably not. The expedition would have returned and reported about the demons by now.
Yet the Royal Guard are digging for gold in such peace.
Who cares! Thanks to the royal vault, our pockets will be filled with gold.
I guess the kingdom needs supplies as well, especially at a time like this.
Maybe so...
Well, it's not my place to intervene. This isn't even my country.
Still... I can't help but wonder. Would we be able to defeat the demons without any help?
No worries! Cleo, the archmage will--
We can always ask for help elsewhere.
Roi! Don't interrupt me! Focus on your job as my guard!
Interrupting unnecessary speech doesn't come in the way of my job.
What did you say?! Why you...
Cleo, maybe we can let Roi finish?
H-huh? Um... sure, if you want.
Thank you.
I'm only letting you speak only because Frey wants to hear the rest!
I wasn't thanking you.
Stop! Both of you!
Roi, who else can help us?
I wasn't referring to a specific person.
Have you ever heard of something called 'Guild'?
It sounds familiar... I think it's what you call a group of people gathered with the same purpose.
Correct.
We might as well visit the Guild Center to check if they have any Mercenary Guilds.
Oh! Mercenary Guild sounds like a great idea!
I've only heard about merchant guilds or production guilds.
It's no wonder. We don't usually work with members of the guild.
Do you know where the Guild Center is?
Of course. I haven't been there before, but It's very close.
Excuse me.
Welcome. Please state your purpose of visit.
We'd like to get help from the Mercenary Guild!
Huh? Aren't you... Cleo?
Do I know you?
Of course. You've grown.
How do you know Cleo?
Well, anyone who's ever stayed at the Tower of Sage must have heard about Cleo the troublemaker.
I'm Veronica. I'm currently in charge of supplies in the Guild Center.
Urg. You're from the Tower of Sages?
I have left the tower around... 5 years ago.
Already gained fame as a troublemaker 5 years ago?
Forgive me for asking, but what is your name?
I'm Veronica, the Guild Center's Quartermaster.
Let's stay in touch. I'd like to hear everything about Cleo's childhood.
Shut up, Roi!
Why would someone from the Tower of Sage even be working at the Guild Center?
Well, everyone has their reasons, don't they?
I'm quite content with what I have now. I take great pride in what I'm doing.
By the way, you're quite... different from how they described you at the Tower of Sage.
Hmph! All those rumors are basically lies! They're just saying things because they're jealous of my amazing magic!
Well...
I don't think any of the wizards at the Tower of Sage I know would make up tall tales and spread them for fun.
Maybe you've changed while we were apart, Cleo.
I guess... that makes sense as well.
Well, anyway, you said you needed help from the Mercenary Guild?
It seems you're all preparing for some adventure. Why don't you join a guild?
Or you can establish your own guild, too.
Hiring mercenaries isn't a bad idea,
but joining a guild and taking on challenges with other guild members will give you a head start.
The sorcerers from the Tower of the Sage don't usually spread groundless rumors...
Maybe you have changed since then, Cleo.
......Maybe so.
All jokes aside.
I understand we can hire mercenaries here?
True, but I would like to suggest something else.
How about joining a Guild?
Or you can always open a Guild yourself.
Why would you suggest that?
It...It's just...
You seem to be hiding something from us.
No, I--
Orvel keeps getting more and more suspicious.
There seems to be a conspiracy going on...
It's a misunderstanding!
I just thought.... You guys seem very skilled, but also seem to be in need of money...
I'm... sorry if that sounded rude...
No it's... true.
I don't know why you're looking for mercenaries
but joining a guild will definitely help you.
Yes, you can always hire mercenaries, but becoming a member yourself...
It might bring you something much more valuable than gold...
It's been so long since our last visit to Orvel.
Yes, we've been through much during our short adventure.
I wonder what lays ahead of us.
For now, let's forget everything and rest at the inn.
Camping's great and all but... I miss sleeping in a bed!
I agree, we should rest while we can.
Sounds good.
I know a place for such occasion.
You won't regret it.
Can we stop by somewhere just near hear?
I'm sure it will be of help to you.
Hello there! Are you here to slay the Flame Dragon? Do you mind if we join you?
Yanne~! Over here!
You seem way too excited, Mediana.
Yes, this is my first dragon raid!
Better be careful. You can never be off guard when facing a dragon.
But I'm with you, Yanne, why would I fear anything?
Oh, how rude of us not to introduce ourselves!
I'm Mediana.
And this is the famous Dragon Slayer Yanne, slayer of the Mad Dragon Svelta!
Y..you're embarrassing me...
I'm just a simple monster hunter.
I speak nothing but the truth, Yanne.
Never mind her...
Should we go ahead?
Yanne! Our party members requested for a CC skill!
No problem, just concentrate and... attack!
Don't run away, Temeraire!
You're sick, you need my help!
It's no use.
How would you cure a dragon driven mad by demons?
Mental illness is a form of sickness too.
It can be cured with proper treatment and diagnoses. I will never give up!
Temeraire isn't mentally ill. 100 years ago, the Dark Lord's force--
That's not true.
There's no such record that the Dark Lord made the dragons go mad using magic.
Dragon's appearance might resemble that of mere reptiles, but they are beings of great intelligence.
There must be an explanatory reason for their madness.
Sure, sure, whatever you say.
Careful, the hatchlings are approaching.
Sweet babies, are you worried about your mama?
Don't be afraid, I'm here to cure her.
Stop trying to tame them. The only way to get through is by defeating them!
You came back, Temeraire.
Now, get ready for your treatment.
Mediana, you shouldn't be diagnosing dragons with mental illness.
...When you're the one that seems the most insane.
I can proudly say that my mind is as healthy as anyone.
And I never try out dangerous experiments on others.
But... that dragon is a danger to everyone else, so...
Now, now Temeraire, don't be afraid~ Here comes the needle~!
Who should cure who...
Good work, everyone.
Since this is your first battle against dragons, you can keep the loots.
Is that all right with you, Mediana?
...Mediana?
Now there, Temeraire, don't worry.
You will get the treatment you need.
Though my cure may be a little rough...
It's all for your own good.
Don't be afraid of my needle~!
I wonder what would happen if a fire dragon is injected with a fiery shot?
Fufufu... How interesting...
Ha..haha.. Um... I guess Mediana isn't interested...
So... take whatever you want.
It was a pleasure to meet you.
Humph, I did tell you that I can sharpen a blade fatal enough to catch a dragon...
But I'd never have guessed you'd actually go and hunt them down.
I guess I can't call you newbies anymore.
Judging by the loots you brought... Was it Temeraire?
Come by the forge again when you gather enough coins.
I have some dragon gear lying around...
You can pay for them with the dragon's coins.
Hah, another fool with no sense of fear.
What is this place?
This is where they locked away the evil creatures they captured during the past war.
Rumor has it that some of the creatures were used as subjects for forbidden experiments.
Yes, this is a prison.
It's literally hell down there, but I won't stop you if you dare to enter.
Best of luck.
Hey! You guys look pretty tough.
Are you talking about us?
Would you be interested in a match?
This place is full of contestants that put their lives on the line for honor!
It's the perfect place for the likes of you!
Materials... I need more materials!
Bring me more money and materials, greenhorn!
Who are you calling a greenhorn!
Humph. Are you going adventuring with that kind of equipment?
Your weapons are so dull, they can barely cut butter.
I'll fix them up sharp enough to cut through a dragon's scales.
That is, if you have enough gold and materials!
Welcome to Hero's Inn!
Ha ha! This house is full of heroes today.
Oh, Kasel! It's been a long time!
For some reason, it feels like there are a lot of newcomers.
You will find a lot of adventurers these days because there are more demons.
They come looking for companions and end up staying a few days.
If you are also looking for companions, Kasel, do you want to meet them?
It's so hot, even though Pavel cast Frost on us.
I think it got even hotter when we were going through Windland Snow Mountain.
Really? Why can't I feel anything?
Probably because you're immune to heat.
Frey, do you think you can block the heat with your shield?
I can block damage, but not heat... Sorry.
But there's a bigger problem... I feel a powerful evil energy from far away...
Massive dark power is gathered at the top of the volcano.
So, there really is something wrong with the Dragia Volcano.
But didn't the Mad Dragon Temeraire build its lair on Dragia Volcano?
No one would even dare go near that place. Unless it's someone completely stupid.
The Mad Dragon Temeraire?
I think I heard about it back at the Tower of Sage.
If my memory is correct... Isn't it the ancient Red Dragon?
Well, it's just a mad dragon now.
There's a rumor that a hundred years ago, the Demons did something to it that drove the dragon into insanity.
I don't know all the details...
Anyway, that's not the point here.
The real problem is that there's someone crazy enough to inject evil energy into the mad dragon's lair.
Things are starting to get out of hand.
Creating a dimensional rift in such place...
What could the Demons be up to?
We need to find out what's going on.
We may not be able to figure this out now, but we can get some information... Hm?
Why is the Holy Sword...?
Kuh...!
Kasel! What's wrong?
Ugh... Yea. I'm okay, Frey.
I'm not sure why...
But the Holy Sword is reacting to something.
The last power's fragment would be the only thing that would make the Holy Sword react like this.
Isn't Kaulah storing the last fragment of the Holy Sword's power?
Anyway. Nothing will get done if we just stay here.
Let's head to the volcano.
At the very least, we should be able to learn something new.
We can't get to the volcano from here.
Yes, there is a river of lava trickling from the volcano...
Pavel's frost won't be enough to protect us.
Maybe we can try to fly over it on my staff.
We'd need some high flying magic that can last a long time, though,
It's just too dangerous to cross it with common flying magic.
Of course, it would be okay if Cleo went alone since she can withstand the fire.
Hm... What now?
Should we go back to Windland and ask for Pavel's help?
For now, let's go to the northwest since that path seems clear enough.
I'm not sure what we'll do if the lava blocks our way again...
What's wrong?
New intruders.
Four humans, including the wielder of the Holy Sword.
Hmph. I guess Malduk mentioned that one earlier.
Alright. Send a unit.
It should be okay to kill them all.
Understood.
Wait. What about the other intruders?
Dragon's scent detected. Pursuing unit formed.
Falsified traces... Dwarf trap activated.
Draconics, two injured, one dead.
Still in pursuit.
Bah. Weaklings... They're resorting to some annoying tricks.
Alright. I can kill them anytime.
Just bring the dragon to me.
A dragon in one piece. I won't kill it quickly, you know.
I'm excited, hahahaha... Bwahahaha!
Hmph. You seriously can't give up that bad habit of playing with your prey before killing it.
You and that Kallax...
Tsk, Morrah...
It's been a while. So, how is it working for a lowly human?
If you insult Maria in front of me again...
I'll lop off your head.
Hmph. I'd like to see you try.
You haven't been our leader for a long time, Morrah.
You're the still same after a hundred years. We've grown stronger.
All this time, we've been hunting and eating dragons.
Hmph. Know your place, Infira.
Your body has changed because of the souls of the dragons you ate. You're still just small fry.
If you don't want to be called that, try absorbing at least one soul from an ancient dragon.
Bwahahaha, you're saying I can't handle the soul of an ancient dragon?
Alright, I'll prove it.
The prey this time is the Blue Dragon that was once worshiped as the God Dragon.
It's a big shot amongst the dragons that oversee the world.
I'd like to see you try, just like you said.
Well, it doesn't matter. I'll just do what I'm told.
Whatever you do, if it doesn't affect my mission, I have no reason to intervene.
I forgot to ask.
What brings you here?
You ask the obvious.
The dimensional rifts disappeared in the places they've passed by.
Maria was worried that it would cause problems to his plan.
That's why she sent me here. It's the biggest and most important dimensional rift.
Hmph. Even the ancient Fire Dragon Temeraire is in my hands now.
He gave me this power of erosion that can even control dragons' minds.
With this, even the Dragia Volcano is impregnable!
Heh. You mean the one that turned into Mad Dragon a hundred years ago?
What's the point of controlling a mindless beast like that?
It doesn't matter, so long as you can control its power.
Tsk. Let's see how long you can keep talking big like that, Morrah.
Just watch. Once this mission is over, I'll show who is the strongest.
That's only if you complete your mission.
Don't underestimate the wielder of the Holy Sword, Infira.
We don't know what might happen to this place.
Hmph. Just don't get in the way, Morrah.
I don't need your help.
Heh. Good to hear.
I wouldn't help you, anyway, even if you got on your knees and begged.
Just remember this. If you get in my way, or this job goes wrong...
I'm taking your head.
...!? What's this energy?
This incredible mana... What's going on...?
A demon with the power of fire!?
This is... Morrah! It's similar to Morrah's energy!
Kuh, the killing intent itself is so intense...!
Everyone, be careful!
Hmph, I'll show you the power of an Archmage!
My fire magic isn't working...?
This happened when we fought Morrah as well...
In that case...!
Kasel, don't push yourself too far!
Whew... whew... Alright!
It's okay, Frey. I'm used to this power now!
Alright, here I go, Demon!
Grrr, kugh...
Haaaa!!
Tsk!
You think I'll lose you!
In the name of the Goddess...!
Haaa!
Tsk, was it too low...? I just missed the vital point...
Kuh!
Roi!!
Go, Fire Ball!
Ugh, my fire magic isn't working...!
Aaaaaah!
No, Frey!!!
Aaaaaah!!
Kuh, haaaa!!
Roi!!
Kuh, damn it!
Move back, Cleo!
Kuh, he keeps dodging...!
Is he not fighting head-on because he knows it's the Holy Sword...!?
Everyone, dodge!
No, there's no need.
Thank you, Yanne.
Stand up, everyone.
Frey! Are you okay!?
Yes. Yes. I'm okay. I can get up.
Bwahahaha, it's been a while, everyone!
Phillop!?
Save the talk for later! We need to get rid of the remaining Draconics!
Oh, don't worry! I beat them all up a little earlier!
Alright, I'll show you how to hunt Draconics!
Okay!
*Huff...* We defeated them all somehow...
Thank you so much. If you hadn't helped us...
Hahaha. Anyone would've done what I did in that situation.
Anyway. You've all grown strong.
Did you retrieve the power of the Holy Sword that the Barbarians had?
Yes. A wizard named Pavel had it.
By the way, you two were comrades a hundred years ago, right?
Ah, yes, Pavel. That's who you meant.
He was always pretty quiet, so we didn't get to talk much.
His frost magic was truly awesome, though.
Hahaha, I guess he always was the silent type.
Oh, that reminds me...
I still haven't said hello to the others behind you.
I'm Kasel. And these are Frey, Cleo, and Roi.
Thank you for helping us.
Like Phillop said, we just did what we had to do. Don't worry about it.
I'm Yanne, a Barbarian hunter. You could say I'm just an ordinary monster hunter.
Hm? Barbarian...
I'm the Priestess of Water, Laias.
I came from the Shrine of Flow that is under the oasis in Aegina Desert.
Hm? Laias... That Laias!?
That legendary Blue Dragon worshiped as the God Dragon in the desert country!?
Oh? There are still people around who know that story?
I'm flattered... It wasn't really a huge deal.
I just called the rain and made the lands fertile sometimes...
Other than that...
Ha ha, you are so humble.
If it weren't for you, Aegina Desert would've been a wasteland forever.
And Yanne, didn't you beat up a Mad Dragon by yourself a few years ago?
Ah, Mad Dragon Svelta. It was an aloof and prideful dragon in the past.
Although it became a Mad Dragon a hundred years ago because of the Demons...
His soul was distorted with anger and pain.
It was you who helped him go back into the flow of the world.
If you could please not mention that... hahaha...
I only helped because people just asked me for help...
And talking about that with another dragon present is...
I'm sorry for interrupting, but...
May I ask what brings you to Dragia...?
You don't have to be so polite, Child of Fire.
Let's say... We're here because of the large Demon army that attacked the Aegina Desert.
I was cleaning up the remnants of the Undead,
when a bunch of Demons came from the Dragia Volcano.
There wasn't much going on in the volcano when I was leaving...
Then, the dimensional rift in the volcano must have appeared recently.
That's when the Demon army started coming over...
Yes. They even reached the oasis.
With the Draconics that were made to hunt other dragons at the forefront...
My younger brother sensed their threat, so he woke me up from my 100-year sleep.
And then, with the help of Phillop, we were able to push back the Demons to the border of Aegina.
I've fought many Draconics in the past.
I know how they fight and the kinds of strategies they like to use.
But when we were about to leave to Dragia to find out the cause, I saw it.
The ancient Fire Dragon Temeraire was causing a ruckus in Aegina, controlled by Draconics...
We barely stopped him, but he flew in the direction of Dragia.
That's why before coming to Dragia, I asked Yanne for help since she has experience fighting a Mad Dragon.
I have many acquaintances around here since I hunt monsters,
so I heard about it through the Hunter's Guild.
I had just finished hunting a giant scorpion, so I joined right away.
I see... So that's what happened.
I thought Aegina Desert would be fine since there aren't many Undeads there...
In order to protect Aegina from the threat of the Demons,
we'll have to get rid of the dimensional rift in Dragia.
By the way, I guess it was true that dragons fall asleep for a long time!
Hm? But wait...
If you were asleep for 100 years... Were you with the Warrior of the Holy Sword during the Demon War?
Ha ha, I'm sorry, but I wasn't part of them.
Protecting the children of the desert was my priority...
Oh, right. Phillop was the first member I met from the Warrior's party.
Ha ha, I always knew Dwarves were honest, reliable, and trustworthy.
Ahem... Priestess, you flatter me too much.
Why is everyone looking at me like that? It's too much.
Tarkas did a lot more than me!
By the way, didn't you go to Windland?
You met Tarkas, right? How is he doing?
Hm? Why are you making that face?
After Musuclow died, Tarkas declared war on the Barbarian Kingdom.
He rallied the other races of Windland, and started killing the Barbarians.
What? How did that happen?
He said that the humans and their ambition... make the world dangerous.
He declared that he would destroy the Holy Sword, mankind, everything...
He tried to kill us, too.
In the end, I unlocked the power of the Holy Sword... and slashed him down.
He was so close to Kyle...
Tarkas... Why...?
Phillop couldn't have known that. But Yanne, you don't look so surprised.
I heard the news... a while back.
I was in search of work wandering the continent, so I was lucky.
It's lamentable what happened to my people... But it's not like there's no hope.
Even if the kingdom is gone, not all the Barbarians were killed.
Right now, they are led by the chief warrior Gau, signing peace agreements with the other races. They're barely keeping the peace.
They'll have another king later, but first, they have to focus on survival and rebuild.
That's something, at least. Gau is alive and well...
So did Tarkas cooperate with the Black Knight or not?
According to the information from Lewisia, that's still unconfirmed...
Tarkas didn't explain anything until the end.
You've already met Lewisia, the Vampire Princess. Hm...
It doesn't make sense for Tarkas to cooperate with the Demons so easily.
He had great pride as a warrior. I can't believe he would have just succumbed to the Demons.
I'm sure he had a reason.
I believe I said this earlier, but...
Nothing will get solved by us just standing here.
We just need to do what we can.
Then let's move to the west, where the Draconics aren't doing much.
It will be the long way, but it will be safer.
So there are turtles and Muhrooms in the volcano, too.
They can actually live in such a hot place...
Can we grill them?
Hm? Is it that hot?
It doesn't feel hot to me...
Phillop is a Dwarf, and Laias is a dragon, so I understand,
but how are you able to deal with this heat, Yanne?
You have resistance to fire like me?
I'm not sure,
but I got covered in Svelta's blood when I hunted it.
Hm... Or it might have something to do with the dragon meat I ate after that?
Dragon meat...?
I shared the dragon's scales, bones, and useful parts with the residents
to help them rebuild the village that Svelta had destroyed.
But then, so many of the people were starving.
So I cut out Svelta's meat to share with them, and I ate some myself.
Ever since that, I've never gotten ill, and I don't get hurt as much.
A dragon's body is imbued with the power of nature, so it can be a powerful magic catalyst.
In the past, there were people who wanted to hunt dragons for that reason... but no one survived.
If you had eaten the dragon for your own selfish interests, I would be angry.
It's clear that your intentions were good, though, so I'd like to praise you, Yanne.
I'm sure Svelta would have been relieved to know that he was
useful to the earthly beings before leaving.
Hmm... I see.
Anyway, talking about food makes me hungry.
If there's not enough food, how about monster meat?
It's pretty good!
What about Bloodsucking Spider legs...?
I've tried it. It's so chewy and good.
Well, what about Muhrooms...?
Muhrooms are good when grilled. Just like meat.
Maybe it's because they're mushroom monsters?
Hah...
Hm. Another lava river.
I don't see a way around it...
There's nothing to worry about.
We have a dragon!
We'll be fine if we fly over it!
Well... This morphed form suppresses some of my powers.
If I go back to my dragon form, all my power will be unlocked.
Then, all the Draconics in this area will react to that power and go berserk.
I don't think we can deal with both Temeraire and that large army of Draconics.
Hm... That would definitely be dangerous.
Do Draconics always go berserk when they only react to the power of dragons?
I'm not sure about that... But they don't go berserk when I'm in my morphed form.
I'm not sure if they don't feel the need to go berserk when my powers are hidden, or they just don't...
Hm. So, that's why you're in that form...
Then how do we cross the lava river?
It's not like there's no way in this form.
It can be a little dangerous, so I'll create a shield.
Embrace -
This is... a water shield?
It's different from Frey's holy shield.
You better cover your ears.
Well, you'll get used to it after a few times.
Overflow -
The waterfall is going into the lava...
Wow, look at all that vapor...!
If it wasn't for the shield, we would've been burned...
I can just harden the lava temporarily, without the need to fly over, right?
Ha ha, it will start flowing again after some time.
Oh, the heat will be dispersed by the Bubble Shield, so it should be fine.
I... didn't think of this.
As expected of a dragon!
Well, water is the specialty of the Blue Dragon.
Ha ha, shall we get going then?
Now that we crossed the lava river...
Let's talk about what we should do next.
First, we need to take care of the mind control on Temeraire.
As long as he's there, we cannot enter the Dragia Volcano.
Fighting strong Demons and the ancient Red Dragon at the same time...
I don't even want to think about it.
That's why we better separate the Draconics and Temeraire first.
After that, we can remove the control over Temeraire's mind, or at least seal his movements.
That's why we got away from where the Draconics are.
Hahaha, we scouted this area out a few days ago.
There aren't many Draconics to the northwest of here.
We saw some scouts coming, but they're just flying around.
There are also monsters scattered around the volcano, but that's no problem.
There are a few hidden caves to the northwest of here that lead to the Dwarven Kingdom.
The Dwarves have set a lot of traps around there to protect the land.
Even Draconics won't be able to access it easily.
Draconics are Demons that were made to hunt dragons.
If they find out my location, they'll come and hunt me down.
But if it's an area dangerous for them...
They will choose the most efficient way.
They will use Temeraire, since traps won't work on him.
I get it. You want to use their own strategy against them.
I like that plan.
But I have two questions before that...
What's the chance that the Draconics and Temeraire will attack together?
Very low.
Temeraire is a Mad Dragon. He doesn't care what's around him and just uses his full power.
Even the powerful Draconics will be danger if they get caught in battle around him repeatedly.
Hm, understood.
Then, my next question.
Do we have a plan if Temeraire comes here?
While we take care of Temeraire,
Yanne will shoot an arrow with a purging spell at Temeraire's head.
That should remove the mind control on Temeraire, forcing him to sleep.
Hm...
What if that fails?
Then... We'll have to defeat Temeraire with force.
I don't want to hurt my old friend anymore...
But I'll do it if it comes to that.
Enemy... Found.
Kill them all, except for the dragon.
Ha ha.
I'd like to see you try, you wannabe dragons.
In the name of Laias, the water of life, and the adjuster of the flow of the world...
I'll annihilate you.
Kuh...!
Serious injuries... Retreat!!!
We better report to Infira...
The bait has been set.
Now we just need to wait for Temeraire to come here.
If their leader is Infira... I think we'll succeed.
If he's anything like before, he'll let his impatience get the best of him.
Infira... Who is that?
I don't think his name was mentioned in any of the books I've read in the Tower of Sage.
Infira is one of the commanders of the Draconics.
